loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison used his previous loan to buy animal feed, as he had planned. He has applied for another loan to enable him to buy more stock for his Agrovet business. Harrison is optimistic that his business will do well after this loan. He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to add stock of animal feed.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is married with four children who are attending school. She and her husband manage their own farm to make a living. They have about two hectares of farmland where they grow and harvest rice to sell at local markets. Heang’s daily job is to maintain their land in good condition and to cover her family’s costs of living by selling products grown on her land. She is able to earn 7 USD daily. 

Heang is requesting a loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her family to improve her family’s household sanitation practices. Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, she is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for her family to improve her family’s household sanitation practices

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a  mother of five, sells fish and spices in her village while her husband does farming. For many years, they were able to support the family. She needs more stock to offer to her customers. For this, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy more variety and volume of fish to sell.   

She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. She wants to have a better living with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more variety and volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is married with three children. For many years, she has sold fish in her village with the help of her family. Arlen makes a good living from this and she also sells groceries from her home. She has many loyal customers and is satisfied with her business.  

Arlen is requesting a loan to buy additional fish to sell. In the future, she wants to improve her business and reach her dream of having a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Meet Teresa, a mother of five children, all of school-going age. She is a very hard-working farmer who has been farming for the past 18 years. Her primary sources of income are eggs, tea, and green vegetables. Teresa says that she enjoys farming because it is her main source of income, but her biggest challenges are poor roads and the lack of market for her produce.

Teresa says that Juhudi Kilimo was her best choice for this loan because they meet clients' financial needs. With this loan, she will purchase a dairy cow to add to her cows so that she can increase milk production, and therefore increase her income. This will lead to an improvement in her children’s education and also in her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonidiza

texts.en:
Leonidiza operates a farm, growing and harvesting rice for sale.  For many years helping her husband, she has earned a good income for the family.

To improve the farm, Leonidiza borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer. Her photo was taken in her house, where their income goes. Leonidiza hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Zita

texts.en:
Ma. Zita, has been operating her own general store while her husband does farming to make a living. For six years in running the business, she was able to maintain and sustain her store and had support for her children's education. She always found many ways just to augment their living. 

To improve sales, Ma. Zita took a new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Constant

texts.en:
Constant is a 30-year-old male politician living in Kasese Uganda. He has been in politics for the last three years and works nine hours a day. Constant also earns additional income from farming. He is a hardworking and faithful man.

Constant is requesting a loan to pay for his school fees. He does not have adequate capital to cover the cost.

loans.use: to pay his tuition

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 49 years, Sokhorn is a married mother of seven children living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been selling rice and Khmer noodles. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Sokhorn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for supporting her business. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy materials for supporting her rice and noodle business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy winter clothing like jackets, tracksuits and blankets

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is widowed with seven children. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store charcoal. She buys bags of polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone. 

Dama needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal because her number of customers is increasing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase \onions, cooking oil, and Maggie

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
This is Bardhe and Mark, whose old house fell to the ground on its own since it was very old, and they had no money to do any repairs. Recently they started building a new one, yet they have no money to finish it, and this is why they are requesting compassion from lenders. The amount of money that they are seeking is 150,000 Albanian Lek. Kindly note that Mark has twice had surgery to change his heart valve.

Bardhe and Mark live in northern Albania, and she is dressed in the traditional costume that is very typical amongst all rural women in their region: white, black and sometimes red are the most preferred colors of their costumes, with a black head scarf with hair braids underneath the scarf and in front of their ears in order to cover them. 

Agriculture/livestock is their activity; they’ve got goats and pigs and sell their babies at the market. Added to this, they plant and sell dried beans, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to finish off the house, since the old house fell to the ground because it was very old, and now they have no place at all where to stay

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Khoern is 55 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two sons in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice on six hectares of farmland. To supplement her income, her husband also works for others for a fee. Khoern's current business earns her about 48,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

This is Khoern's fourth loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader of the group, Khoern wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air cooler and fabric.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn, 42, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she farms rice and works for others for a fee. Thorn currently earns about 42,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back her past loans. 

Thorn is the leader of a group loan request. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. Thorn hopes to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $1,200 helped Zainab to buy makeup and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 27-year-old refugee. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a labourer and they live in an IDP settlement. Hayat has been raising seasonal vegetables and greens for six years and has good experience in this area. She raises onions, cucumbers, and greens, selling them at local bazaar. Her monthly income is 180 AZN.

Vegetables are in high demand during the year and people buy them every day. They use vegetables to cook soups, dishes with fried vegetables, and other tasty things.
 
Hayat’s income from gardening doesn’t cover her family’s needs. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy other kinds of vegetables and fruits to raise.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of vegetables and fruits to raise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, groundnuts, etc.  in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa  is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in the family house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees. Hasifa has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. 

Hasifa has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling and frying samosas and chapatti. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transport and thieves.  

Hasifa is aspiring to become a wholesaler, to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation, and also to get enough profits to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the timely loan and it also reaches to the bottom poor.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Urafiki Grp Group

texts.en:
Nyamtondo is a mother of three grown children who are at school. She is aged in her 30s and is married. For three years now, she has been managing a charcoal store. She opens her business from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. per working day and is able to make a very small monthly profit. 

Nyamtondo is requesting a second loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock her store with a few sacks of charcoal. She has paid back successfully the previous loan. With the business profit, she used it to cover school fees and part of the household expenses. In the coming years, Nyamtondo would like to manage a big general store. She will use this loan to replenish her charcoal inventory.  

Nyamtondo will share this loan with her loan group, "URAFIKI GRP," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her charcoal inventory.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes, and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her movements, and transportation and thieves. 

She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premises and also to build a house on her plot of land. She resides in a rented house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es estudiante, trabaja y también es madre. Está cursando el último año en Licenciatura en lenguas y Cultura Guaraní.
Comenta que su meta como docente es especializarse cada ves mas y así poder ayudar a los niños y adolescente a poder aprender la lengua guaraní, que es muy bella y uno de los idiomas oficiales del Paraguay. También comenta que quien la inspira es su hijo, ya que quiere poder darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener y que no pase por privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, que le será de mucha ayuda ya que es un gasto un poco elevado que podrá cubrir con esto.
texts.en:
Delia is from the city of Paraguarí. She is a student, she works, and she is also a mother. She is in the last year of her degree program in languages and Guaraní culture. She says that her goal as a teacher is to specialize more and more, and in this way be able to help children and adolescents to be able to learn the Guaraní language, which is very beautiful and one of the official languages of Paraguay. She also says that it is her son who inspires her, since she wants to be able to give him everything that she could not have, and for him not to be deprived.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay her degree expenses, and it will be very helpful to her since the expense she will be able to cover with this is a bit high.

loans.use: to pay degree expenses

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a forty-two-year-old married woman with five children who all go to school. She has been a teacher for five years in Kasese, Uganda and she also does farming as an additional source of income.

Violet wants money for home construction and hopes to improve on her family's standard of living despite her low salary. She is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: For house construction

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 37-year-old married male with four children, of whom three go to school. He has been a primary teacher for 13 years and does farming to supplement his income. Stephen wants money to pay school fees for his children so as to meet his vision despite his low salary pay.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 29-year-old married male with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a primary teacher for eight years, and works eight hours a day plus does farming for additional income. 

Jacob wants money to pay for school fees, and hopes to improve his standard of living; however, low salary is the challenge being faced. 

Jacob is a honest man.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Meet Naomi, a farmer living in Kisii area of South Nyanza, with her husband and five children, some of whom are of school-going age. She has been doing farming for the past 16 years and her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and vegetables. In farming, her major challenge is poor roads and lack of good and reliable markets.

Naomi wants to expand her farming and that’s why she decided to take a Kiva loan from Juhudi Kilimo which will enable her to purchase a dairy cow that will produce more liters of  milk she can sell in the market. This will increase her income base and thus help her take care of her family comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, a mother of two, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in their farm planting and harvesting crops. 

For  years in managing the store, she was able to sustain and support her children’s education. She also had some home improvements done to her house because she earns a better income from their farm.  

In order to offer more to her customers, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a forty-year-old  single woman with three children. She has been dealing in agriculture for ten years and works twelve hours  a day  on a busy street. Immaculate wants money to buy fertilizers to sell.She is faced with a challenge of bad weather. Immaculate is an honest woman.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy day-old chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water and a food container to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ladies clothes

loans.name: Mum

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kos Krolor district of Battambang province, Mum is a 26-year-old married father of four children who are dependent on him and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of his family’s income for two years. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet his family’s needs. 

This is the second micro loan for Mum with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now  Mum will use his loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to increase his current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
This is Arben with his three beautiful children. They are seeking your compassion to make basic repairs to their rundown, little family house. 
The age of the children ranges from 3 to 13 years old.  Their house has moisture inside and the family doctor said that the reason Arben's children always get sick is because of their poor living conditions.

Arben and his family, including his two elderly parents who are living with them, live in a northern coastal town located near two lagoons where Arben works in a fish factory. They are very poor. Arben's income is just a little, and his parents’ pension is small, as well. His wife is a stay-at-home mom, but not by choice.

Kindly note that Arben has been a very good client of VisionFund Albania for long time now.

loans.use: to make basic repairs to the rundown family home because the children always get sick due to their poor living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air cooler and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Sukhom

texts.en: Sukhom is 40 years old. She is a married woman with two children living in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. One of her children is with her in the picture. She and her husband are farmers. Both of them earn approximately $8 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to buy the in-ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Sukhom hopes that she can renovate her house and her children can get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To buy the in-ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Chhun Group

texts.en:
Chhun is 55 years old. She is a widowed mother of three children at Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, and she is a farmer. Chhun is the leader of this group.

Chhun will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Chhun would like to build a house.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Shafa

texts.en:
Shafa is a 44-year-old single woman and she lives with her old parents. The members of her family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. The source of the family’s income is gardening. Shafa has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for 24 years and has good skills in this area. Her monthly income is 140 AZN.

Fruits and vegetables are in high demand because people use them for desserts and national dishes. They use fruits for juice, fruit salads and jams; they use vegetables for dovgha, vegetable salads, etc. 

Shafa needs money to pay for her parents' medicines. She has to increase her income and applied for 1,500 AZN in order to build a greenhouse and increase her harvest.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and increase harvest

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia es estudiante de la Carrera de Radiología y está cursando el último año.  Su meta es recibirse y entrar como radióloga en algún Hospital, para poder de esa forma ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten de sus servicios, además también para que por medio de ese trabajo pueda aumentar sus ingreso y poder también ayudar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos.
Su inspiración siempre va a ser su familia por que siempre la ayudaron y estuvieron con ella cuando más necesitaba.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a radiology student and is completing her last year of school.  Her goal is to graduate and start as a radiologist at a hospital, so that in this way she can help other people who need her services.  Additionally, she will also be able to increase her income with this work and be able to help her parents, who have little resources.

Her inspiration is always going to be her family because they have always helped her and were there for her when she most needed them.  She asks for this loan so that she can pay for the university fees, and thus be able to continue studying and fighting for her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo es de la ciudad de Villarrica, comenta que a la par que estudia también trabaja, ya que la vida es muy difícil y es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, y comenta que su sueño es poder trabajar en una empresa importante, y si se puede también manejar su propio negocio, y es por eso que se está esforzando bastante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en: Arnaldo is from the city of Villarrica, and he says that as well as studying he works because life is difficult and it's the only way to be able to move forward. He is studying Business Administration and says his dream is to be able to work in an important business. Also, if he is able, he wants to run his own business, and that is why is he's making such an effort. He requests this loan to be able to spend it on paying his university fees and in that way be able to continue growing and working.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
A married woman living in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Savy is aged 47 years and married. For the last 12 years, Savy has been farming rice while her husband works as a paid worker. 

Savy has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is 51 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. Rice farming is the main source and pig raising is the second source of her family’s income, which she has been doing for 20 years. She earns approximately 3,3000 KHR per day. 

Lon requesting a loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy pig feeds for her pig. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is 49 years old, married, and has nine children, three of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day. 
 
Srey has been with VisionFund for four cycles and fully paid back the past loans. She is leading her group to request a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn additional income from her current business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is widowed and has five children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years. She works from home, seven days a week. She sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal to resell.

She aspires to start going to villages for charcoal, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Primero De Enero  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Primero de Enero está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. Las socias son mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que trabajan a diario para entregarles a sus familias un mejor porvenir. Sus créditos son invertidos para mejorar sus negocios.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, forma parte del grupo de crédito Primero de Enero desde hace 3 años, le gusta su grupo de crédito por la solidaridad, amistad y apoyo que se brindan entre sí para cumplir sus metas.
La Señora. María tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven independientes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María es una mujer luchadora que labora como empleada privada en turnos rotativos, en el tiempo disponible se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, su esfuerzo en cada uno de sus trabajos le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa para aumentar su mercadería. Su meta es  agrandar su negocio.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Primero de Enero [January First] credit group is made up of eight female members and one male, who live in the Valle del Cuenca parish.  This parish is known for the beauty of its countryside.  Its people work in trade, animal husbandry, and agriculture.  The members are enterprising and hardworking women who daily work to give their families a better future.  Their loans are invested to improve their businesses.

One of the members of this group is Señora María.  She has been part of the Primero de Enero credit group for three years.  She likes the group because of the solidarity, friendship, and support that they give each other to reach their goals.

Señora María is 58 years old.  She is the single mother of three adult children, who are married and live independently.  She doesn’t have her own house, so she is renting.  

Doña María is a fighter who works rotating shifts as a private employee.  In her free time she works in clothing and cosmetics sales.  Her efforts in each of her jobs have allowed her to get her children ahead.  She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of cosmetics and clothing to increase her stock.  Her goal is to expand her business.  

The small photo is of two members who couldn’t be present when group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly esta casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Nelly sigue dedicandose a ser peinadora y necesita un credito para comprar liquidos  para base de cabello, tintes, cremas, etc. Con el fin de fortalecer su negocio El esposo de Nelly cuenta con una renta de jubilación pero eso no es suficiente, por eso Nelly necesita colaboración extra.
texts.en: Nelly is married and has three children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to her. Nelly continues to be a hairstylist and needs a loan in order to buy perm solution, dyes, creams, etc., with the goal of strengthening her business. Nelly's husband has a retirement pension, but that is not sufficient, so Nelly needs extra cooperation.

loans.use: to buy perm solution, dyes, creams, etc., for her beauty salon

loans.name: Méyévi Fortune

texts.fr: Fortune est une femme de 47  ans. Veuve, elle  a deux enfants âgés de 24 et 26 ans. Revendeuse depuis 2009, Fortune vend des draps, des coussins sur son étalage. Elle demande  à ce jour un quatrième prêt pour s’approvisionner. Avec ce crédit, Fortune pourra augmenter son stock. Elle se fait aider par une personne de temps en temps. Avec ses profits supplémentaires, Fortune prévoit créer d’autres points de vente ce qui l’aiderait à gagner plus .Elle cherche à toujours faire plus pour ses enfants  et pour cela elle travaille sans relâche pour agrandir son commerce
texts.en: Fortune is a 47-year-old woman and a widow. She has two children, aged 24 and 26 years old. A retailer since 2009, Fortune sells bed sheets and pillows from her display of goods. Today, she is asking for a fourth loan to resupply herself. With this loan, she will be able to increase her stock. She is helped by one person from time to time. With the additional profits, she plans on creating other sales outlets, and this will help her to earn more. She is always looking for ways to do more for her children, and so she works tirelessly to expand her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets and pillows

loans.name: Soutoura 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SOUTOURA  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame  ROKIA  assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais plus 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Soutoura  4  are married women with an average age if 37 and on average four children. Most live in traditional families in Siekourani, a village in the rural community of Loulouni, Kadiolo circle, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. They have been collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. 

They are on their eighth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. The crop cultivated is peanuts in the case of Madame Rokia, sitting in the middle in the photo of this group of women. 

With her loan, Madame Rokia intends to buy one sack of 50 kg of fertilizer plus 25 kg of fertilizer, one tin of herbicide and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares. After the harvest, her produce is sold in the village and in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 85,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest on it on the one hand, and to help her husband with the daily expenses of the family on the other.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and agricultural seeds and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of six children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business, a mini-grocery. She has been in this business for 10 years, selling on a retail basis seven days out of every week. She generates additional income by roasting maize. Her major business challenges include thieves, law enforcement officers, and transportation.

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use it to buy more loaves of bread, tins of Blue Band, and packets of tea leaves.

She aspires to become a wholesaler, to educate her remaining children up to university level, and also to build herself a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more loaves of bread, tins of Blue Band, and packets of tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro esta casado y tiene dos hijos Pedro vive en La Paz en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad La casa no esta en buenas condiciones, falta el acabado de la parte frontal, la vivienda no cuenta con una puerta principal y el amurallado esta cubierto por unas calaminas. Igualmente, Pedro trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y a veces debe manejar toda la noche. Por eso, necesita un credito para pagar el mantenimiento de su vehiculo Aunque su esposa le ayuda con la economia familiar Pedro tiene muchos gastos y labores por completar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Pedro is married and has two children. Pedro lives in La Paz in an adobe house that belongs to him. The house is not in good condition. The front part is not finished, the house does not have a front door, and the walls are covered by some sheets of corrugated iron. Likewise, Pedro works as a public transportation driver and sometimes he has to drive all night. Because of this, he needs a loan to pay for maintenance on his vehicle. Although his wife helps him with the family finances, Pedro has a lot of expenses and work to complete, so he needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es: Sintia es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en La Paz, ella ocupa una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres Sintia es agricultora y se pasa la mayor parte del tiempo agacachada para recoger sus productos con el peligro de que las lluvias provoquen un desbordamiento del rio y que pierda sus cosechas. Por eso Sintia quiere un credito para comprar ganado y dedicarse a engordar a los animales para venderlos. Sintia recibe ayuda de sus padres pero esta colaboración no basta. Por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Sintia is single, has no children, and resides in La Paz. She lives in an adobe house that belongs to her parents.

Sintia is a farmer and spends the majority of her time strategizing on how to gather her produce before the rain provokes the river to flood, threatening her with the loss of her harvests. As a result, Sintia now desires a loan to purchase cattle and to dedicate herself to fattening the animals in order to sell them.

Sintia receives help from her parents but their collaboration isn't sufficient.  For this reason, she needs our help.

loans.use: to begin buying cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Soutoura 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe  SOUTOURA 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame AMINATA débout  à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the group SOUTOURA 6 are married women, who average 36 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SIEKOURANI, a village in Commune Rurale de LOULOUNI, Cercle de KADIOLO, Région de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their eighth solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. AMINATA, who is standing second from the left in the photo in this group of women. With this loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining 0.25 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicide, and seeds and to cover labor costs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es soltera pero tiene dos hijos, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres. Jacqueline trabaja como secretaria y necesita un credito para hacer un pago a la universidad de su hija que se encuentra estudiando administración turística. Jacqueline es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y no recibe ayuda del padre de sus dos hijos, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Jacqueline is single but has two children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to her parents. Jacqueline works as a secretary and needs a loan to make a payment to the university where her daughter is studying tourism administration. Jacqueline is a the only source of income in her household and does not receive help from the father of her two children, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to make a payment to the university where her daughter studies

loans.name: Femmes Leaders Viii Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Femmes Leaders VIII regroupe 8 personnes dont 3 hommes et 5 femmes. Ils s’activent tous dans le commerce et cela depuis longtemps. La responsable du groupe, la dame NDIACK, mariée et mère de famille, a acquis une expérience de 15 ans. Elle évolue dans la vente de draps et tissus pour femmes: ainsi elle a besoin de crédit pour acheter des tissus et en faire des draps pour les revendre à ses clients et tout autre produit dont la vente est susceptible de généré un bénéfice. Elle travaille de 7h à 18h du soir. Grace au crédit, elle pourra diversifier ses produits et services mais aussi mettre un peu d’argent de coté. NDIACK rêve de devenir une grande commerçante et ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation générale. De ce fait elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
The loan group Femmes Leaders VIII comprises eight persons (3 men and 5 women). The group members have been active in commerce for a long time. The group’s official, Ms. NDIACK, is a married mother and has acquired fifteen years of experience. She works at selling bed sheets and fabrics for women; thus, she has need of a loan to purchase fabrics from which to make bed sheets to resell to her customers, as well as to purchase any other products she can likely sell to generate a profit. She works from 7 AM to 6 PM. 

Thanks to this loan, she will be able to diversify her products and services and also to put aside some money. Ms. NDIACK dreams of becoming a major merchant and opening a grocery store. She therefore would be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets and fabrics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 21 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, posee mucha clientela, su granja la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su casa, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de vitaminas y concentrado para seguir con la crianza de cerdos y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 21 years old and lives in his own house with his family. For the last 3 years he has been raising and selling pigs and he has a large clientele. His farm is located behind his place of residence. He helps with the household expenses with the profits from his sales. The client is requesting a loan to buy vitamins and concentrated feed to continue raising pigs so he can enjoy a better quality of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Soutoura 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SOUTOURA 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame AFOU débout  à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais plus 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Soutoura 5 are married women with an average age of 36 and on average four children. Most live in traditional families in Siekourani, a village in the rural community of Loulouni, Kadiolo circle, Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali. They have been collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season.

They are on their eighth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. The crop cultivated is peanuts in the case of Madame Afou, standing second right to left, in the photo of this group of women.

With her loan, Madame Afou intends to buy one sack of 50 kg of fertilizer plus 25 kg of fertilizer, one tin of herbicide and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares. After the harvest, her produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 85,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest on it on the one hand, and to help her husband with the daily expenses of the family on the other.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and agricultural seeds and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Rahiza

texts.ru: Рахизе 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Рахизы- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Стартовав в 1974 году, благодаря упорному труду Рахизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 лошади, а также есть земельный надел мерою 2,50 ГА, на котором ежегодно она выращивает картофель, фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также она хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения и ГСМ для проведения весенне-полевых работ. Рахиза является лидером группы "Береке-6", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Рахиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Rahiza is 64 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up three children. Rahiza has a higher education. As a main source of income for her family, she is raises livestock and crops. Started in 1974, thanks to Rahiza's hard work she currently has on her homestead two horses, and also has a plot of land measuring 2.50 hectares, on which annually she grows potatoes, beans, and clover for personal consumption and for sale. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Rahiza turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow for increasing her headcount, and she also wants to acquire mineral fertilizers and fuel for conducting the spring planting work.

Rahiza is the leader of the Bereke-6 group, which consists of two other people. Rahiza plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals and wants to save money to build a new home.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Julissa

texts.es:
Juana tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de Santiago y es una muejr con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como promotora en uan empresa de la ciudad y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para oder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad.

Juana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ela podrá apoyar a su madre para terminar de construir su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder tener un mejor lugar para vivir, de esta manera juana seguira trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle uan vida digna a su hijo y darle una buena profesión”.
texts.en:
Juana is 30 years old and lives in the District of Santiago. She is a member who has the tremendous drive to succeed. For this reason, she works as a promoter for a company in the city. This enables her to generate income in order to get ahead. Most importantly, she is the mother of a three-year-old child.

Juana is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to help her mother with finishing the construction of her house. This will give her a better quality of life and allow her to have a better place to live. Juana continues to work toward fulfilling her greatest wish of providing a decent life for her son and seeing him have a good profession.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her mother's house.

loans.name: Mil Amores Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios, y lo coordina la señora Idalia de 23 años y casada se dedica a comercializar ropa y calzado en su domicilio, el crédito lo solita para la compra de mercadería como es licras, blusas, talladores, blúmeres, brazieres, camisetas, sandalias, etc., tiene tres años de tener este negocio y con los créditos ha logrado aumentar el inventario con productos que antes no ofrecía. Los otros socios son los señores Rafael de 54 años comerciante de piñatas en su domicilio y Ervin de 44 años comerciante de dulces, tostaditas, golocinas, etc., de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three members. The coordinator is Sra. Idalia. She is 23 years old, married, and sells clothes and shoes from her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise such as spandex, blouses, corsets, bloomers, brassieres, T-shirts, sandals, and other items. Idalia has been in this business for three years and the loans have increased her inventory with products that she was not able to offer before.

The other members are as follows:
• Sr. Rafael is 54 years old and sells piñatas from his home.
• Ervin is 44 years old and sells sweets, plantain chips, snacks, and other products as a street merchant.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing, sandals, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 59-year-old married woman living with her family in  Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, has been operating a piggery for the past three years, while her husband does farming that meets their day-to-day expenditures.

Erlinda joined GDMPC earlier this year  for easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative has been approved. The money from this loan will buy feeds and additional piglets to raise. Erlinda wants to improve her business as well as the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Gulsayra

texts.ru: Гульсайра, 42 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Гульсайры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Стартовав в 1994 году, благодаря упорному труду Гульсайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 лошади и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока, молочной продукции, мяса и скота составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсайра обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Gulsayra is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Gulsayra has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she is involved in raising livestock. Having begun in 1994, thanks to Gulsayra's hard work she today has on her homestead: five dairy cows, two horses and 15 sheep. Monthly income from the sale of milk, dairy products, meat and livestock amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Gulsayra applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow for expanding her livestock count.

Gulsayra plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the count of domestic animals and wants to save money to build a new home.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with seven children, all whom attend school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Juliet has a business of selling local gin and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerycans of local gin. Juliet works seven days out of every week and sells on both retail and wholesale levels. Her major business challenges include rainy season, defaulters and thieves. Juliet is aspiring to sell wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more jerycans of local gin.

loans.name: Javier Rene

texts.es:
Javier nació en el departamento de Chuquisaca y vive desde hace ocho años en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Es el mayor de cinco hermanos. Javier nos comenta que su mamá siempre se dedicó a los labores del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos y que su papá tiene su propia tienda de decoración de interiores donde él trabaja y se esfuerza mucho por hacer siempre lo mejor. Por otro lado, es ayudante de docencia en varias materias de la facultad de economía de la Universidad Estatal. 
Actualmente Javier quiere realizar una maestría en Marketing Management ya que considera que de esta forma podrá ampliar sus conocimientos, mismos que le ayudaran a hacer crecer y fortalecer el negocio de su familia, por este motivo, solicita un crédito educativo ya que no tiene los ingresos suficientes para realizar esta especialidad. 
Además Javier nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños, mismos que quiere hacerlos realidad como el de tener su propia consultora de marketing y como el de continuar dando clases, convirtiéndose en docente titular, así como consolidar la empresa de su padre.
Javier de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a él se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Javier was born in the Chuquisaca region and has lived in the city of Cochabamba for the last eight years. He is the eldest of five brothers. Javier tells us that his mother was always dedicated to housework and taking care of her children and that his father has his own interior decorating shop where he works and labors to always do the best. On the other hand, he is a teaching assistant in various subjects at the economics faculty of the State University.

Currently, Javier needs to complete a Marketing Management course since he believes that he will be able to expand his knowledge in this way which will help him to grow and strengthen the family business. For this reason, he is requesting an education loan since he does not have sufficient income for this specialty.

Additionally, Javier tells us he has many dreams which he wants to make a reality such as having his own marketing consultancy and continuing giving classes, becoming a full professor as well as consolidating his father's business.

Javier is thankful in advance to the people who help others through their economic resources and generate new opportunities to grow like what he is receiving now.

loans.use: to pay for a Marketing Management course.

loans.name: José Moran

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 28 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos él vive con sus padres y se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, también el en tiempos libres se dedica a a aprender mecánica automotriz, ya que un amigo le está enseñando en su taller.
José solamente estudio hasta quinto grado, ya que no quiso seguir estudiando prefirió ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar la agricultura, se dedica a esto desde hace unos diez años también al servicio de aprendiz de mecánico, él trabaja todos los días en horarios de 6:30 a 4:30 de la tarde,  su trabajo le queda a unos tres kilómetros de su casa.
 el crédito lo necesita para construir una pequeña vivienda en la propiedad de sus padres, con el financiamiento comenzara a construir la vivienda, sus sueños son tener su propia casa y casarse.
texts.en: José is a young 28 year old entrepreneur. He is single, has no children and he lives with his parents. He works as a farmer. In his spare time he is learning to be an auto mechanic as a friend is teaching him in his shop. José only studied up to Grade 5. He didn't want to study further, he preferred to help his parents at farming. He has been doing this for 10 years and also learning about mechanics. He works every day from 6:30 am until 4:30 pm. His work is located about 3 km from the house. José needs the loan to construct a small house on his parent's property. He will begin construction with the loan. His dreams are to have his own house and to get married.

loans.use: to construct a small house on his parent's property.

loans.name: Johana Danicela

texts.es:
Johana es una joven de 23 años de edad,  que está terminando su carrera de inglés, esta soltera, ella actualmente está trabajando en un colegio y vive con sus padres quienes son los que le han ayudado a ella con su estudio.

Johana posee un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa,  ya tiene dos años de tenerlo esto lo aprendió necesariamente, ya que con lo que gastaba en la universidad sus padres ya no alcanzaban a cubrirle y ella tuvo que buscar la manera de generar ingresos para ayudarse con los gastos, este es el único negocio que ella ha tenido de lo cual se ha ayudado de gran manera ya que se ayuda así misma y a sus padres, el lugar donde ella va a dar las clases le queda va unos 50 minutos de su casa, viaja en autobús, su madre cuando ella anda dando clases le ayuda con el negocio. Su horario es de 7 a 4 pm.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar blusas de varios estilos, pantalones, camisetas, vestidos, ropa para niños, ropa interior, etc. Ella lo que desea es mejorar su negocio porque dice que los clientes le solicitan que surta más su negocio y ella para no dejar ir los cliente quiere comprar más ropa y otra parte para sus gastos que tiene en la universidad ya que aún no se ha graduado.

Sus sueños son poder graduarse y ser toda una profesional,  para trabajar mucho y recompensar a sus padres todo el sacrificio que ellos están haciendo con ella.
texts.en:
Johana is a 23 year old young woman who is finishing her English course. She is single. She is currently working at a high school and lives with her parents who are helping her with her studies.

Johana has a small business selling clothing. She's had it for two years. She learned out of necessity since, with what she spent on university, her parents could not cover all expenses and she had to look for a way to generate income to help them with the bills. This is the only business that she has had which has helped greatly as it helps herself and her parents. The place where she goes to give classes is 50 minutes away from her house. She travel by bus. When she goes to class, he mother helps her with the business. Her hours are 7 to 4PM.

The loan that she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy various styles of blouses, trousers, shirts, dresses, children's clothing, underwear, etc. What she wishes is to improve her business because she says that her customers request that she stocks her business more and she wants to buy more clothing so customers don't leave. Another part is for her university expenses since she has not yet graduated.

Her dreams are to be able to graduate and be a professional, to work a lot and compensate her parents for all of the sacrifice they have made for her.

loans.use: to buy various styles of blouses, trousers, shirts, dresses, children's clothing, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Rwentobo Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
Rwentobo Tukwatanise is a new group located in Rwentobo Rushenyi Ntungamo district. It’s comprised of men and women whose major activities are retail businesses, boda boda cyclists and a few are engaged in agriculture. They applied for a loan through the group. 

Jovailo, a subsistence farmer, is proud to belong to the group because it has helped her to get ahead in her farming. She has learned better farming methods and record keeping through the business meetings with the Ugafode business development officers. She has also obtained loans which she would not have gotten since she has no security. Jovailo will use the loan to mulch her banana plantation. She thinks this will improve her yields and better her income. She is hard working and thanks the lenders for the job well done.

The tenth person in the photo is the Ugafode credit officer; behind Jovailo (front-right).

loans.use: To buy mulch for her banana plantation

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin is 39 years old and a widow with two children who are dependents. She lives in a rural village of the Lerk Daek district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, rice farming has been her family’s main source of income for 15 years. 

Savin has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and better support for the business. Currently, she can earn about 2,2000 KHR per day. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 65 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Alfredo vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que ese el que muestra en la fotografía y así seguir con su trabajo de cultivo, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 65 years old, has been a farmer for several years. His principal crop is corn. He sells his products at the different markets found near his place of residence. Alfredo lives in a house he owns with his family group. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., and improve the land (seen in the photograph) and thus continue with his farming so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Soutoura 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SOUTOURA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame FATOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  108 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Soutoura 3 are married women who average 31 years of age and 3 children each, and most of whom live in traditional families in Siekourani, a village located in the rural commune of Loulouni in the Kadiolo circle, region of Sikasso (3th administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 8th collaboration with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. Fatou grows groundnuts. She is the group member standing first from the right in the photo. She will use her loan to buy two 50-kg sacks of groundnut seeds and two jugs of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.75 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and at the Sikasso markets to a clientele consisting of men and women, cash or credit. 

Mrs. Fatou expects to earn an average profit of 108,000 FCFA per campaign. She will use her profits to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with the household’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Femmes Leaders X Group

texts.fr: Le GPF FEMMES LEADERS X regroupe 09 femmes et 01 seul homme qui ont des liens de parenté. Ils évoluent tous dans le commerce de produits divers. La responsable du groupe, la dame RAMA, s’active dans la vente de friperies et du charbon et cela depuis 3ans. RAMA, âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’ainé a 27 ans et le plus jeune, 5 ans. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne. Elle demande le crédit de ce montant pour renforcer son commerce et diversifier. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Avec une augmentation de revenus, elle veut bien construire sa maison et sécuriser sa famille
texts.en:
The group called GPF FEMMES LEADERS X is composed of nine women and one man who are all related to each other. They have been working at selling various products. The representative of the group, Madame Rama, sells used clothing and charcoal and has been doing this for three years. 

Rama, aged 47, is married and the mother of eight children, the eldest being 27 and the youngest 5. Madame Rama  helps cover their daily expenses. She is requesting this loan to grow her business and diversify. She begins her workday at 8 am and ends at 7 pm. With an increase in her earnings, she wants to build a house and provide security to her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and charcoal to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 20 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz desde hace algunos años, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder continuar con sus siembras y así seguir ayudando a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is 20 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has been working in agriculture for some years, specifically growing corn. He sells his product in the area around where he lives. With his profits he helps with the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicide, etc. and improve the land shown in the photo. He wants to continue with his growing so he can continue to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc to improve the land.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es: Braulia vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento de Cusco, Perú). Braulia tiene 38 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Braulia lives in the city of Pilcopata. (The city of Pilcopata is located in the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in the region of Cusco, in Peru). Braulia is 38 years old and is dedicated to farming and raising young animals like guinea pigs and hens. She has already been dedicated to this business for many years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts forth. She is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman who gets her family ahead since she belongs to the Paititi community bank. At this time, she needs a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens. She is thankful and values the loan and promises to pay her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en: Mercidita provides for the needs of her six children, raising pigs to earn a living. Aside from this, she also grows vegetables in her garden in a little plot from their farm to earn extra income. She needs improvement of her piggery for it is one of the sources of income for the family. Without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy feed to boost her pigs. Her future plan is to build a piggery shelter where she can keep pigs to raise as expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Johnny, father of an only child, provides transportation services in their village to make a living. For more than a year, he has earned well to provide for the family.  He needs repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle to improve the services to his customers. With his micro finance loan of GDMPC, it helps to cover the costs for repairs and maintenance. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle to use for expansion of his services.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer guerrera y muy diligente, se desempeña desde hace algún tiempo como reformadora y reparadora de calzado. Esta actividad la aprendió al lado de un familiar quien la ejerció durante 20 años.
Se vio obligada a trabajar en el momento en que se quedo sola con sus dos hijos pequeños y vio la necesidad de responder por el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Ella es muy reconocida en su sector por la labor que realiza de una manera impecable y siempre con amabilidad.
Desea poder mejorar sus ingresos y darle un pequeño empuje a su actividad, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para comprar insumos como pegas, tintes, tachuelas y suelas; con estos elementos podrá capitalizar un poco su negocio y generara mejores utilidades al aumentar su producción de trabajo.
Ella quisiera expandir su negocio y ofrecer empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Paola is a fighting and very diligent woman. She has worked hard for some time as a shoe repairer. She learned this work at the side of a relative who performed the work for twenty years.

She feels obligated to work right now since she was left alone with her two small children and saw the need to respond to support the family.

She is very well known in her area for the impeccable work she performs, always with friendliness.

She wishes to be able to improve her income and give a small push to her work. Consequently, she is requesting economic support to buy tools like tacks, glues, dyes and soles. With these items, she will be able to capitalize her business a little and generate better profits to expand her production. She wishes to expand her business and offer employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy tacks, glues, dyes and soles.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 60 years old and married with one child who is in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sergia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sergia has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from a pig fattening business and her general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.ru: Зинаиде 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Зинаиды - среднее образование, на протяжении 19 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 дойная корова и 2 лошади, а также есть земельный надел мерою 2,50 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Дополнительно Зинаида на заказ шьет национальные изделия. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зинаида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры и ГСМ для организации весенне-полевых работ. Зинаида является участником группы "Береке-6", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Зинаида планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а именно приобрести бычков, и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zinaida is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising three children. Zinaida has a secondary education. For the last 19 years, she has been raising livestock and crops. Currently, she has on her homestead one dairy cow and two horses, and she also has a plot of land measuring 2.50 hectares, on which annually she grows beans and clover for domestic consumption and sale. Additionally, Zinaida takes orders for sewing national items. Monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zinaida applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to purchase nitrates and fuel to organize the spring planting work.

Zinaida is a member of the Bereke-6 group, which consists of two other individuals. Zinaida plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the count of domestic animals, and specifically to acquire steer, and wants to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy nitrates and fuel

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of three daughters and one son. Her husband works at a government entity. Basma has been supporting her husband in paying their household fees by selling clothes for five years. She is now planning to expand her business by adding new products such as housewares and another collection of clothes, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes and to add housewares sales to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and insecticides to help her coffee crops

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa was born in 1976. She is married and a mother of 2. Her husband is a Chef. Randa has been trying her best to assist her husband in covering for their children's needs by decorating traditional men's head wear called "Hatta". Her nice work has attracted more customers and she is now planning to expand the quantity of her products by purchasing the needed thread and raw materials that she is using for decorating. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials that she needs for decorating traditional men's head wear called "Hatta"

loans.name: Gladis Concepción

texts.es:
Gladis de 25 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato no pudo continuar con sus estudios universitarios por su situación económica,  ella tiene 2 hijos de las edades de 5 y 3 años, es  madre soltera en su casa viven 5 personas su papá, mamá, un hermano el cual trabaja en una tienda. 

Gladis se dedica a vender en una tienda,  tiene que trabajar para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y poder aportar a su casa para la ayuda de sus padres. Ella tiene ya 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que es tan productiva para ella, el negocio lo tiene en su casa no tiene que salir para trabajar; comenta que siempre recibe el apoyo de sus padres en los trabajos de la tienda cuando ella no está.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar pan, golosinas, bebidas, embutidos, pollo, detergentes, entros productos para ampliar la variedad y cantidad disponible para sus clientes.

De esta manera desea tener mejores ingresos de dinero y poder darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y poder apoyar más económicamente a sus padres.

Gladis desea para un futuro poder ampliar su propio negocio de ropa y poder comprar una casa para vivir más cómodamente ella y sus hijos y desea que sus hijos estudien mucho que se superen y así ellos puedan defenderse económicamente en el futuro.
texts.en:
Gladis, 25, went to high school, but could not pursue a university degree because of her financial situation. She has 2 children, aged, 5 and 3, she is a single mother and lives with 5 other people in her house: her father, her mother and a brother that works in a store.

Gladis makes a living selling products at her store, she needs to work to provide for her children, and contribute to the household expenses and help her parents. She has been working in her store for 3 years, which have been very productive for her. She has her business in her house; she doesn’t need to go out to work. She tells us that she can always count on her parents’ help to take care of business when she leaves.

The loan she is applying for at CrediCampo will be used to buy bread, candy, soft drinks, cold cuts, chicken, laundry detergents, among other products to widen the variety and quantity of products available to her customers.

With this, she wants to obtain a better income and be able to provide her children with a better life and to be a greater financial help to her parents.

Gladis wants to expand her own clothing business in the future and to buy a house to live more comfortably with her children. She wants her children to study a lot, so that they will be able to defend themselves financially in the future.

loans.use: to buy bread, candy, soft drinks, cold cuts, chicken, laundry detergents, among other products to widen the variety and quantity of products available to her customers.

loans.name: Savy Group
