texts.en: Savy is 39 years old. She is married and has four children, and she lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Savy is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Savy would like to run a small restaurant and build a new house.

loans.use: To obtain a latrine for her family

loans.name: Koemhan Group

texts.en: Koemhan is 47 years old. She is married and has two children, and she lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and pig raisers. Koemhan is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Koemhan would like to sell pork in front of her house. Moreover, she hopes that her house can be rebuilt next year.

loans.use: To provide a latrine for her family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap-making materials like caustic soda, powder, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of soaps for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, wood, bricks, cement, and sand to repair the roof, walls, and floor of the kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 26 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con sus padres, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, gaseosas, agua, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en la gasolinera que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos de su casa, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más productos por mayor y así seguir con su negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The borrower is 26 years old and lives in a family member's house with his parents. He sells drinks, juices, soda, water, etc. His business is in a gas station that is close to his place of residence. With what he earns from his sales, he helps with the expenses in his household. The borrower is asking for a loan in order to buy more wholesale products and in this way continue with his business, which is his only source of income, and to be able to have greater economic stability along with his family.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale products such as drinks, juices, soda, water, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Jasiriamali Grp Group

texts.en:
Juma, who is a Vice-Chair of Jasiriamali group, has been managing a cereals business. He has been in this enterprise for fifteen years now. Juma is aged early 50s and is a married man. His business is open from 7am to 6pm each working day and he is able to make a good profit. Juma has ten dependents; seven are school-aged children and three are married. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first loan which he will use to restock his business with sacks of corn (to grow his business capital). Juma dreams of expanding his cereals business to other regions. He will share this loan with his loan group "JASIRIAMALI" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock his business with sacks of corn.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella sigue siendo una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Francisca buys and sells wood. She has been in this business for several years and it is going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. She continues to be an enterprising and hard-working woman who gets her family ahead. She belongs to the “Paititi” communal bank. At this time she needs a loan to buy wood and she promises to pay her monthly installments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Diriangen Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario está formado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora Rosa de 47 años de edad, casada y a cargo un hijo de 10 años es propietaria de un restaurante en el mirador de 
Diriá, este negocio lo impulso hace diez años por lo que es muy reconocido en la zona, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de jugos, gaseosa, carne de res, carne de cerdo, pastas, frutas, verduras, etc., la socia alega que los créditos le han sido de mucha ayuda para su superación personal y laboral, debido a que reinvierte sus ganancias, permitiéndole realizar mejoras a su vivienda y a su restaurante. Las otras socias son la señora Alba de 48 años dedicada a la producción de artesanías en barro y las comercializa en Catarina y San Juan de Oriente, y la señora María de 47 años quien vende nacatamales en su domicilio. El grupo tiene 14 ciclos de estar prestando en la institución por lo que se ha visto que son mujeres trabajadoras y responsables en sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful members.  Rosa is 47 years old and serves as the group’s coordinator.  She is married, has a 10 year old son and owns a restaurant on a lookout point.

She would say that she started this business ten years ago and it’s very well known in the area.  She is asking for this loan to buy juices, soft drinks, beef, pork, pastas, fruit, vegetables, etc.  She says that the loans have been very helpful for her personal and professionals success because she reinvests her profits, allowing her to make improvements to her home and restaurant.  The other members are Alba, 48, who makes crafts out of clay and sells them in Caltarina and San Juan de Oriente, and Maria, 47, who sells nacatamales out of her home.  The group has been borrowing from the institution for 14 cycles and the members have shown themselves to be hardworking and responsible women when it comes to their obligations.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, Pure Water, sugar, and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe soles that he needs for his production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more flour for making Arbic 'Shrak' bread and a new collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Armida

texts.es:
Armida de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a que por su situación económica debía trabajar para aportar dinero a su casa y ayudar a sus padres, es casada su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos como el frijol y el maíz, tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 16, 13,5 años los cuales estudian viven con ella y su esposo.
 
Armida se dedica a los oficios domésticos una actividad que ha realizado desde que era pequeña debido a que su madre le enseño a realizarla, ella con este oficio ha podido sobrevivir en muchas circunstancias de su vida. Armida también está aprendiendo a hacer pasteles en un curso de pastelería que en un futuro ella abrirá una pastelería que le generara ingresos económicos a su familia,  comentaa  que en ocasiones también recibe el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, semilla de maíz y frijol, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra.
Armida desea para su futuro poder hacer crecer sus cultivos y poder sobrevivir económicamente de su trabajo y poderle dar una vida mejor a su esposo e hijos. También mejorar su vivienda,  para vivir más cómodamente con sus hijos y también lograr poner un negocio de pastelería.
texts.en:
Armida is 35 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She could not continue to study due to her economic situation. Instead she had to work to bring money into the house to help her parents. She is married and has 3 children, aged 5, 13 and 16 who study and live with her and her husband. Her husband works as a farmer growing basic grains like corn and beans.

Armida does domestic work which she has done since she was small. Her mother taught her how to do this as she has used this work to survive through many circumstances in her life. Armida is also learning how to make pastries in a course. In the future she will open a pastry shop to generate income for her family. She states that she gets help from her husband and children sometimes.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy manure, corn and beans seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and to pay for labor. Armida would like to increase her crops and be able to survive on her earnings. She wants to provide a better life for her husband and children. she also wants to improve her house so she can live comfortably with her children and be able to open her pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy manure, corn and bean seed, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 40 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area, located in the Phnom Srouch district of Kompong Speu province. She has four  dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. 

Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business. With the current business, she can earn approximately KHR 8,500 per day.

This is the first micro-loan for Em with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Em wants to use this loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income, to make a living better and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chanbo

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kos Krolor district of Battambang province, Chanbo is a 36-year-old widowed mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for two years. She can earn about 48,300 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut is 25 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kos Krolor district of Battambang province. She has one dependent son to take care of and now he is in school in the local area. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for two years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 77,300 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Nut with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Nut will use her loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Don Jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia tiene 10 hijos pero solamente cuatro depende de él los otros 6 son independientes pero le ayudan económicamente, él se dedica al cultivo de tomate y pepino, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con ,a ayuda de sus hijos logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, don Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, controles de plaga, etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, 55 years old, lives in his own house. He has 10 children, but only 4 are dependent on him. The other 6 are independent, but they help him financially. He grows tomato and cucumber. He sells his products in the various markets close to his place of residence. With what he earns from his sales, and with the help of his children, he succeeds in covering the household expenses. Jose is asking for a loan to buy seed, manure, pest control, etc., in order to continue with his crops and to be able to give his children a better quality of life with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres y su compañera de vida, el posee un molino desde hace varios años tiene mucha clientela principalmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas pues ahí llegan a moler el maíz para elaborarlas ya que el es una persona muy amable y responsable, El cliente solicita un crédito para poder comprar cuchillas, discos y todas las herramientas necesarias para tener un buen molino y así seguir con su trabajo para darles a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client, age 25, lives in his own house with his parents and his live-in partner.  For a number of years, he has had a mill.  He has a large clientele, mainly women who make tortillas who come to grind the corn in order to make them.  They come to him because he is a kind and responsible person.  

He is asking for a loan to be able to buy blades, discs, and all the necessary tools to have a good mill and, in this way, to keep up his work in order to give his family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs, and necessary tools.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 personas emprendedoras    y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “la vecindad  del cinco”.  La Sra. Elsa   de 42 años de edad  y madre de  3   hijos,  ella se dedica hace 6 años  a la venta de comida en un pequeño mercado (alquilado).  La Sra. Elsa nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus  comidas  tanto en el día como en la noche    y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en compras más productos  (arroz, menestra, aceite, sillas, mesas, cubiertos, platos etc.) y  así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Elsa   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Elsa   se le distingue por su chompa de color  violeta  es la primera señora de la mano derecha ,  se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: This is a group composed of 6 enterprising and very creative people. These are the members of the “la Vecindad del Cinco” communal bank. Elsa is 42 years old and the mother of 3 children. She has worked for 6 years selling food in a small market (renting). Elsa tells us that she has come to have loyal clients which generate enough income to cover the household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own stand to sell food during the day and also at night and gain more revenues. With the loan she will invest in buying more products (rice, groceries, chairs, tables, cutlery, plates etc.) and be able to get ahead. At the same time Elsa and all the members are grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the loan and the confidence placed in them. Elsa stands out wearing her violet sweater and is the first person to the right. They say good-bye with the promise to fulfill all their proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy groceries, rice, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es: Roxana tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 18 años, 17 años y 15 años de edad. Roxana se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante. Tiene mucho tiempo de recorrer las principales zonas de su localidad ofreciendo variedad de prendas de vestir lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Roxana desea construir un moro de retención y terminar un cuarto por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI esperando poder contar con el financiamiento para comprar los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.
texts.en:
Roxana is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home, together with her three children, ages 15, 17, and 18.  

Roxana works in clothing sales, as a mobile vendor.  She spends a lot of time going through the main neighborhoods of her town, offering a variety of outfits for sale.  This allows her to take care of the household expenses.  

Roxana wants to build a retention wall and finish a room, so she is asking for this loan from FUSAI, hoping to be able to count on the loan to buy the materials needed, such as bricks, cement, sand, and rebar.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and rebar to build a retention wall and finish a room.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es la venta de ropa como por ejemplo polos, faldas, ropa interior, camisas, blusas y otras más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como ropa. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Paulina sells clothing such as, for example, polo shirts, skirts, underwear, shirts, blouses, and more. She has had this business for several years already, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who moves her family ahead, since she belongs to the Paititi communal bank. On this occasion she needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing. She is thankful for and appreciates the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es la venta de mercadería como frazadas, sandalias, zapatillas y algunos productos de ferretería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatillas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Carmen sells merchandise such as blankets, sandals, tennis shoes, and some hardware products. He has had this business for several years already, and it is going very well for him thanks to the dedication he brings to his work. He belongs to the Paititi communal bank, and on this occasion he needs the loan to buy tennis shoes. He is thankful for and appreciates the loan, and he promises to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to stock his sales business.

loans.name: Beatrace

texts.en:
Beatrace is a thirty-five-year-old, married woman. She has four children, and all of them go to school. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Beatrace has been in agriculture for sixteen years. Fish selling supplements her income. Beatrace wants money to buy pesticides. She hopes to have a residential house. However, bad weather is a challenge. Beatrace is a hardworking woman.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her plantation

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a married woman who was born in 1965. She is a mother of 5. Her husband is a retired man who is currently working as a bus driver, and his income isn't enough to cover his children needs. For that reason, Alia started her business at her house making detergents and selling them. She has been doing this for six years. She is now seeking a loan to buy more raw materials that she needs for making detergents so that she will raise her productivity and profit.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making detergents.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province, Sokheang is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for over ten years. She can earn about 37,500KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sokheang has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and has completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and better support for the business. Now she is applying for  a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer for her farmland.

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is 42 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area, located in the Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. She has two dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. 

Teaching is the primary source of income and working as a paid worker is the second source of her family’s income to make a living. With the current job, she can earn approximately KHR 33,300 per day.

Tima has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles already and she completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family with sufficient food and better support for the business. 

Now, Tima is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. She hopes to grow rice fruitfully and healthily, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 32 years old and married. He lives with his family in a rural area located in the Kos Krolor district of Battabang province. He has two dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Farming is the primary source of his family’s income to make a living. 

This is the second micro-loan for Sophal from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He will use his second loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to increase his current business so as to earn a larger income, make a living better, and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Justice Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Justice and the group is made up of three members. They are from Dansoman, a place in the Greater-Accra region. They are hardworking, responsible people, driven to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resource,s they were unable to study and they had to work from an early age, to help with the household expenses. 

Wisdom is the featured borrower. He has a small grocery store that sells edible products such as rice, beans, tinned tomatoes, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and soft drinks, in small quantities. He works in his business the whole day, selling his products so that in the near future he can make more money. 
Justice group is grateful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to people of few resources, so that they can have decent jobs.

They need a total amount of GHS 3450 to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as rice, beans, tinned tomatoes, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and soft drinks,

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos y también con la venta de verduras y frutas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él sigue siendo un hombre emprendedor y trabajador  que saca adelante a su familia pues él  continua siendo parte  del banco comunal “Paititi”, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mariano works selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and noodles, as well as vegetables and fruits.  He has been working in this business for a number of years at this point and it is going very well for him, thanks to the effort his puts into his work.  He continues to be an enterprising and hardworking man who is getting his family ahead.  

He continues to be part of the Paititi communal bank.  At this point, he needs a loan to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.  He is committed to making his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, sheets of metal, and poles to construct a basin and repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Mohamed Chernor

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven-year-old Mohamed Chernor.  He is married and has two children aged twelve and three. In 2011, Mohamed Chernor established his business selling extension cables, light bulbs, mobile phone accessories, switches, CDs and pure water. 

He began his business because he dropped out of school after Year 3 and began to learn carpentry but was not much interested in carpentry. He made some hangers and sold them, and the money he gathered was used to start a cosmetics business. Mohamed then changed his cosmetics business into a business selling phone accessories and electrical items because his profits in the cosmetics business were low. 

Mohamed's current business is located in the city center and his main customers are young women and men around town. He works fifteen hours a day, seven days a week. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more mobile phone accessories and electrical items. He hopes that this loan will help him attract more customers. In future, Mohamed plans to complete his building and educate his children. This loan will help him achieve his plans. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more electrical and mobile phone accessories for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sportswear and t-shirts for men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted drinks and snacks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en: Lukas is a 32-year-old married male with three children who all go to school. He has been in the agriculture business for three years. He is located in a rural area in Kasese, Uganda. He earns additional income from a retail shop. Lukas hopes to educate his children. However, limited capital is a challenge. Lukas is an honest man.

loans.use: to pay for labour and to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch is thirty-five years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kos Krolor district of Battabang province. She has three dependent children to take care of. They are in school in the local area. Farming is her family's primary source of income. With the current business, she can earn approximately 43,900 KHR per day.

This is Sreytouch's second microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan and she wants to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so she can earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blankets for reselling

loans.name: Bunnoeurn

texts.en:
Bunnoeurn is thirty-one years old and married. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Kiri Vong district in Takeo province. He has three dependent children to take care of and they are in school in the local area. Rice farming is the primary source of income for his family and they also earn a secondary income from raising cows. Currently, he can earn approximately 35,300 KHR per day.

Bunnoeurn has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid his previous loans. These previous loans enabled his family to have enough food and also supported their businesses. Now he is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice fruitfully and healthily so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: José Toribio

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad, está acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en ocasiones a trabajar también como doméstica y vendiendo en una tienda en la ciudad. Con su esposa ha procreado 4 hijos,  el mayor tiene 11 años y está estudiando 6° grado, la segunda tiene 7 años y estudia 3° grado, el tercero tiene 5 años y está en kinder y el ultimo tiene 1 año. José se dedica a trabajar muy duro para llevar el sustento a su familia ya que son muy unidos y son personas muy honestas. 

José se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde su niñez,  él aprendió este rubro de su padre quien le enseño desde pequeño a trabajar la tierra, en la temporada que no se puede cultivar por la escases de agua trabaja en la ciudad, en una bodega de despacho de frutas y verduras,  en esas temporadas él tiene que alejarse de su familia ya que el horario de trabajo para inicia a las 2:00 am que es cuando llegan los pedidos y los compradores a dicho lugar así que tiene que madrugar mucho, por ello él se queda en su lugar de trabajo ausentándose de su familia por semanas para así poder llevarles el dinero para comida y estudio a sus hijos y esposa, para que no les falte nada.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y herbicidas para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijol la cual hace en conjunto con su esposa, con dichas compras podrá tener un pequeño ahorro en dinero y tiempo ya que lo trasladara de una sola vez y el costo será más bajo y teniéndolo en la casa podrá aplicar a su cultivo el tratamiento adecuado y en el tiempo indicado para una mejor producción.

En el futuro desea tener una casa de un mejor material,  ya que la de ahorita es de lámina y desea construirla de bloque para darle una mejor seguridad y condición de vida a su familia, desea seguir trabajando muy duro para darles lo que ellos se merecen a sus hijos desea que se formen como personas de bien y que tengan todo el estudio.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old and his wife is a housewife.  Sometimes she also provides domestic help and works at a store in town.  They have four children, their oldest son being 11 years old and attending sixth grade.  Their seven year old daughter is in third grade, and their five year old son attends kindergarten.  Their youngest son is one year old.  Jose works hard to support his family because they are very close and honest people.   

Jose has been farming since childhood.  He learned this trade from his father who taught him to work the land.  During the season when he can’t farm because of scarcity of water, he works in the city at a fruit and vegetable warehouse and he has to relocate away from his family during that time because the shift begins at 2:00 am.  This is when the orders and buyers come in and he has to rise early, so he stays at his work place away from his family for weeks at a time so he can earn money to feed them and pay for his children’s education and so they want for nothing.

He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans between him and his wife.  He will be able to save some money with these purchases because he can transport it all at once and it will be less expensive.  He will also have it at his home and can apply it to his crops when he needs to and have better production.

In the future he wants to have a better built home because his current one is metal and he wants to build one out of cinder blocks so he can provide better security and living conditions for his family.  He would like to continue to work hard to provide what they deserve.  He also wants his children to become people of means and have a full education.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Theurn

texts.en:
Theurn is 22 years old and married with one child. She lives in the rural village of Kos Krolo in Battambang province. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for ten years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 35,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Theurn with VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy the fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Sophea is 29 years old and married, with one child who is not yet attending school. She and her husband have been farming for 11 years. The current business earns her family about KHR 35,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.

Sophea has been with VisionFund Cambodia for one cycle already and now she is applying for another loan, in the amount of KHR 250,000. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farming business, to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin, 62 years old, is a widower with no children. He lives in a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Preahnet Preah district. He earns a living through rice farming, which he has been doing for 35 years. He has been a teacher for 20 years as well. The current business earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Phin has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Phin successfully used the first loan to better support his family and increase his family’s business. Now he is applying for a new loan. He wants to use his loan to buy the fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and increase his current business to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure, among other items, to help her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water, sugar and cigarettes to expand her business

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is thirty-five-year old Isata.  She is married and has one child, aged two.

In 1995, Isata established her clothing and textile business, selling mainly “brillion”, lace, cotton and woolens. She began her business because she realized it was the only means for her survival and better living standards for her and her family. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata requires a loan in order to buy additional clothing and textiles for her business. In the future, Isata plans to make a small boot to protect her goods from getting wet during the rains and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cotton, "brillion" and other clothing materials

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel se dedica a la venta de madera y en sus horas libre se dedica a la agricultura, él es una joven trabajador y responsable que vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata donde realiza todos sus actividades. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Samuel es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.
texts.en:
Samuel works selling wood and in his free time he works in agriculture.  He is a hardworking and responsible young man who lives in the city of Pilcopata, where he also works.

He has been in this business for a number of years at this point, and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Samuel is an enterprising and hardworking person who belongs to the Paititi communal bank.  At this point in time, he needs a loan to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more types of food products and to add the selling of more detergents

loans.name: Segundo Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Segundo es un sr de 55 años, vive en Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad grande y comercial, conocida en el país porque es el puente entre la sierra y la costa.
Segundo en esta ciudad cuenta con un pequeño negocio que está ubicado en el centro, un local que arrienda y donde él vende su mercadería, como blusas, pantalones, chompas, perfumes, cosméticos y manualidades, con estas ganancias él puede salir adelante. Vive solo ya que sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y el vive separado de su esposa muchos años.
Segundo es un señor muy responsable y trabajador, atiende su negocio todos los días y los fines de semana baja a sectores rurales a vender su mercadería.
Segundo acudió a la institución por un crédito, con el dinero podrá comprar bultos de ropa americana ya que esta mercadería es la que mas vende, se siente muy agradecido con la institución y Kiva por permitirle crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 55 year-old man.  He lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a large city focused on trade, known throughout the country for being the bridge between the mountains and the coast.  

In this city, Segundo has a small business located downtown—a shop that he rents, where he sells merchandise such as tops, pants, sweaters, perfumes, cosmetics, and crafts.  With his earnings, he can get by.  He lives alone, because his children are already all grown-up and he has been separated from his wife for many years.

Segundo is a very responsible and hardworking man.  He works in his store every day, and on the weekends he heads out to rural areas to sell his merchandise.

Segundo has turned to this institution for a loan.  He will be able to buy bales of American clothing with the money because that type of merchandise is what he sells most.  He is very grateful to this institution and to Kiva for allowing him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy American clothing by the bale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies with which to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops in this new season

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman is 37 years old and married with two daughters.  The members of the family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement.  Suleyman provides for the family by raising and selling fruits in a small yard of his house. He has been working in this area for 17 years and has good skills. His monthly income is 180 AZN.

People prefer to attend Suleyman’s grocery because he is a very kind and cheerful man and always sells tasty and fresh fruits. He knows customers' demands and does everything in order to satisfy them.

Suleyman’s income is too low to cover the family’s demands. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to supply new sorts of fruit seeds and raise them too. This will increase the harvest, the grocery’s assortment, and his income.

loans.use: to supply new sorts of fruit seeds and diversify the assortment of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 22 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, el posee desde hace 3 años una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, elabora pan francés y pan dulce, posee mucha clientela por los buenos productos, la higiene y amabilidad a la hora de vender, el cliente está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de harina, manteca, moldes, latas, etc. y continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This 22-year-old borrower lives with his mother in a relative's house. For three years he has owned a bakery, located in his place of residence. He bakes French bread and sweet breads. He has many customers due to his quality products, cleanliness, and friendly customer service.

The borrower is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase flour, butter, molds, cans, etc. to continue his work. This is his only source of income, and it allows him and his mother to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, molds, cans, etc.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Las Esmeraldas” y  la conforman  07 socios. Beatriz de 33 años de edad, es  separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Hace más de 03 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Dicha actividad le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar. Beatriz tiene el anhelo de instalar su propio restaurante con platos típicos del lugar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de medias, polos, camisas y pantalones. El grupo “Las Esmeraldas” agradece el crédito brindado. Beatriz es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo de color negro.
texts.en:
This is the community bank "Las Esmeraldas" which is made up of seven associates. 

Beatriz is 33 years old, separated, and has one son who is a dependent. For more than three years she has made a living by selling clothing. This occupation has allowed her to generate income for her home. Beatriz has the desire to establish her own restaurant with typical local dishes. 
Her latest loan will be used to purchase socks, t-shirts, shirts and pants. 

The group "Las Esmeraldas" appreciates the loan that they've been offered. Beatriz is the third from the left and dressed in a black polo.

loans.use: to purchase socks, t-shirts, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Ulda Ester

texts.es: Ulda tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 13 y 9 años de edad y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ulda es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora pero sobre todo responsable quien se dedica a la la venta de refrescos naturales y además, trabaja como jardinera en el cementerio de su localidad. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ulda desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda antes que el invierno empiece dado que el agua se filtra.
texts.en:
Ulda is 48 years old, and she lives in her own house with her two daughters, who are 13 and 9 years old respectively, and her son who is 16 years old. Ulda is an enterprising woman. She is hard-working, but above all, she is responsible. She sells organic juices, and she also works as a gardener for the town cemetery. This is how she makes a living and takes care of the household expenses. 

Ulda wishes to improve the living conditions of her house. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet and wood to repair the roof of the house before winter starts, because water filters in.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet and wood to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Maribel  Patricia

texts.es: La Señora  Maribel tiene 26 años tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 2 y 5 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos ella vende api con pastel en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona  de la populosa feria de la 16 de Julio,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de un televisor LSD de 32 pulgadas para su negocio ya que así tendrá más clientela la señora Maribel es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel is 26 years old; she has two children of 2 and 5 years of age. She dedicates herself to the sale of breakfasts. She sells api (non-alcoholic maize drink) with cake at her stall which is located in her own home in the area of the populous 16 of July festival.

The purpose of the loan is to buy a 32’ LCD television for her business because that way she will have more customers. Mrs. Maribel is a hard working person; she has many years in this activity. She is very thankful to the institution for the support they have provided her with since this this is the only activity with she supports her family.

loans.use: buy a 32’ LCD television

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Abu Bakarr.  He is married and has three children, aged 6, 13, and 20. He has one additional dependent who lives with him. He is helping her with her education. 

In 2005, Abu Bakarr established his radio, torch light, phone batteries, and phone accessories business. He began his business just to be self-reliant, after dropping out of school. His business is located at city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,178,000 every month from this business. 

Abu Bakarr would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy radios and mobile phone accessories. He hopes that this loan will increase the stock and expand his business. 

In the future, Abu Bakarr plans to improve his business, to become a well-established shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy radios and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mamie.  She is married and has three children aged 7,15, and 20 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help her with the house chores. 

In 2004, Mamie established her local foodstuff business. She began her business in order to secure a regular source of income for her family. Mamie’s goods are often bought by housewives. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. 

Mamie requires a loan in order to buy gari (cassava flakes) and palm oil for her business. In the future, Mamie plans to give the best education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for degree courses in Agronomy.

loans.name: Adjo Mathilde

texts.fr:
Adjo, qui est âgé de 34 ans, vit dans la ville de Lomé. Depuis 2008,  elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure où elle vend une variété de produits  notamment des défrisants et des mèches. Adjo est mariée à un enseignant. Elle  travaille avec son cœur et met tout en œuvre pour faire accroitre les affaires. Elle met tout en œuvre  pour  gagner de plus en plus de clients et atteindre son objectif qui est celui d'éduquer son seul  enfant dans de bonnes  conditions.
Cette seconde demande de microcrédit  lui permettra d’acheter des mèches et des défrisants .
Adjo s’approvisionne aussi bien au marché de Gbossimé que celui d’Adawlato.
texts.en:
Adjo is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the city of Lomé. She is married to a teacher. In 2008, she opened a hair salon where she also sells various products including straighteners and hair extensions. 

Adjo pours her heart into her work and does everything she can to bolster her business, expand her customer base, and reach her goal of raising 
her child in good living conditions. 

This 2nd loan that she is seeking will help her to buy hair extensions and straighteners. 

Adjo buys her stock at both the markets of Gbossimé and that of Adawlato.

loans.use: to buy hair straighteners and extensions.

loans.name: Haja Jaka

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Haja Jaka. She is married and has four children aged 7, 11, 18 and 26. She has two additional dependents who live with her just to help with their education. In 2011, Haja Jaka established her textiles business. She began her business just to be self reliant and help her husband run the affairs of the home. Her business is located in city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,945,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Haja Jaka requires a new loan in order to buy cotton material. She hopes that this loan will improve her stock and raise her profit. In the future, Haja plans to expand her business to the other part of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy  more textiles for her shop

loans.name: Tereza Elena

texts.es:
Tereza es una señora de 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, dos aún dependen de ella. Juntos viven en casa de un familiar hace varios años en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, ciudad conocida en el país, un sector muy productivo y comercial. En Santo Domingo habita además la etnia Tsachila, indígenas que tienen la costumbre de pintarse el cabello con achiote, por ello el nombre de la ciudad “Colorados”
Tereza es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, actualmente trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante, cuenta con mucha experiencia en este arte, es por ello que hace varios meses ha tenido la idea de montarse su propio negocio, levantar una carpa y vender comida ya que prepara deliciosos platos.
Acudió a la institución para acceder un crédito, con ello comprará mesas, sillas, cocina y comida, atenderá los días viernes, sábados y domingos en un sector cerca a su casa. Se siente muy feliz ya que la institución y Kiva han hecho posible su sueño, se siente agradecida ya que con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Tereza is a 37-year-old woman.  She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are still dependent upon her.  For the past few years they have lived together in a relative's house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a well-known industrial and commercial center of the country. The city is also home to the Tsachila, an indigenous group that has the custom of dying their hair with an extract of the achiote plant, hence the city's name [Santo Domingo of the Dyed).

Tereza is a client of Fundación Alternativa and currently works as a cook in a restaurant. She has a great deal of experience in the art of cooking, and because of this she came up with the idea a few months ago of opening her own business, putting up a an awning, and selling the delicious dishes she prepares. She came to the Fundación to request a loan with which she will buy tables, chairs, kitchen fittings, and food. She will be open on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays in a neighborhood close to her house.

She is very happy that the Fundación and Kiva have made her dream possible, and she is very grateful because the loan will allow her to increase her income and raise her family.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen, tables, chairs, and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale

loans.name: Maa Bhubaneswri Shg Group

texts.en:
Mamata, the lady standing with her hand raised, is 45 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. Mamata is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy rice and selling them in a market in the Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has already had this business for five years, and it is going very well. 

At this time, Mamata is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. This group is made up of neighbours and friends who formed the group together. The members of the group have selected Mamata as their president. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming

loans.name: Elizbat

texts.en:
Elizbat is a 36-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of crockery sales for many years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. Her husband is a private employee and also assists her in selling them to the people of their community and in local market. She makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more varieties of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Marh Group

texts.en:
Marh is a group of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Afia is the leader of the group. She is a 52-year-old married woman who lives with her family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is an uneducated woman, and works as a housewife. She is very active and a dynamic woman. Afia's husband has a small grocery. The income from his grocery still is small. Afia's house lacks many home appliances and most of those she has are very old. She can't afford that condition. The T.V of her house is very old. As a result, she can't watch some programs and news. Therefore, Afia is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new T.V for her house.

Afia hopes the grocery of her husband will become very large in order to provide the family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a new TV for her house.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children. She is involved in the work of hand embroidery. She is very experienced and makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. In order to meet the demands of her customers, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. In this way she will be able to purchase spools of threads along with packs of sequins and beads in different colors. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads along with packs of sequins and beads in different colors.

loans.name: Zeinab Dib

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 38-year-old Lebanese woman, and a married mother of five children. In 2002, Zeinab started her own business, by opening in her house a small room for vending. She sells clothes, with her special selling methods and by offering products of a high quality. She is well-known in her region, for her special talents in her domain.

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection, to meet the needs of her customers and thus to increase her income. Zeinab is very proud of her business growth, and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: To buy a special summer collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Razi

texts.en:
Razi is a 55-year-old refugee. He is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in an IDP settlement.  He is a gardener and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for 30 years. He knows everything about gardening and has good experience in this.  His monthly income is 170 AZN.

Gardening is very spread in Azerbaijan because people have high demand in fresh fruits and vegetables. They buy fruits for dessert or to prepare fruit salads, jam, and fruit pie. They prepare different tasty eating from vegetables. Local people prefer to attend Razi’s grocery, because fruits and vegetables there are always fresh and tasty. Beside that Razi understands that it’s hard for refugees and sells his harvest as cheaply as possible.

Razi needs to repair his house and wants to provide his children with a good education. He doesn’t want them to live a hard life. He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to buy quality garden tools and fertilizers. This will increase harvest and income.

loans.use: to buy quality garden tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Rovzat

texts.en: Rovzat is a single man living with his family in Baku region. They have a family business. So that they have daily food, Rovzat’s father founded his business but today he is old. Therefore, Rovzat was handed the business from his father. Now he decided to take a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijan New Manat, to buy more products to sell. Rovzat says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for support. In the future, he wants to increase his business. In his personal life, Rovzat wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata se dedica a la venta de verduras, comestibles y carnes, ella tiene un puesto de venta en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad de Pilcopata donde expende sus productos como carne de pollo, arroz, azúcar, cebolla, zanahorias, papas, azúcar y otras cosas más.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le cuesta más barato.
texts.en:
Fortunata works in the sale of vegetables, food products, and meats. She has a stand in one of the main markets of the city of Pilcopata where she sells her products, such as chicken, rice, sugar, onions, carrots, potatoes, and other items. For many years now she has dedicated herself to this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

She is an enterprising and hardworking person who belongs to the communal bank "Paititi," and she now requires a loan to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar in bulk since they are cheaper this way.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Musu.  She is married and has four children, aged 7, 13, 20, and 25 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 1999, Musu established her cooking utensils business. She began her business just to be self reliant and help the husband run the affairs of the home. 

Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Musu requires a loan in order to buy sets of pans, dishes, and plastic buckets. She hopes that this loan will improve the stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Musu plans to educate her children to university level and continue to improve her business so that she can secure more revenue for the education of her children. She thanks you for your support and wishes you well.

loans.use: To buy more sets of pans, dishes, and plastic buckets for her stall

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Mabinty.  She is married and has three children who are 4, 9 and 14 years old. In 2006, Mabinty established her synthetic hair and cosmetics business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan in order to buy synthetic hair and cosmetics for her business. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business to the other part of the town and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more synthetic hair and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for garri, milk, sugar, corn flour and local foodstuff

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Abu. He is married and has three children, aged 3, 7 and 14. He has two additional dependents who live with him and are helping him in his business.  

In 2007, Abu established his spare parts and battery charging business. He began his business just to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located at the outskirts of town, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,889,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abu requires a loan in order to buy engine oil. He hopes that this loan will increase the stock and expand the business.

In the future, Abu plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town. He started as an apprentice and now owns his own business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Om- Maen** Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om- Maen**. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Takwa is a 39-year-old widowed woman, living with her parents in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. Takwa is an uneducated woman. She is a very dynamic and active woman. Takwa works as a cleaner in the public sector. 

Her house lacks a washing machine, and she always washes more of the clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired. Takwa couldn't afford this condition. The salary that she receives from her business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the house. For this reason, Takwa applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes.

Takwa looks forward to purchasing all the electronic home appliances in order to make her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her in washing the clothes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 41-year-old married woman. She deals in business of selling milk with her husband for a period of about 10 years. She has two buffaloes for milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She is working hard to bear her household expenditures. She is the mother of four children; two of them are schoolgoing. For the improvement of her business she requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR. It will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing better quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Entisar

texts.en: Entisar was born in 1965. She is a married woman and has four sons and daughters. Her husband is a retired man and his pension isn't enough to cover his children's needs. For that reason, Entisar started her business at her house selling clothes and blankets 10 years ago. She is now out of products and is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of blankets for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets to resell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: At the age of 56, Naseem is a married woman. She is hard-working woman and is helping her family by doing business selling milk.  She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She counts a good client list. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 37 years old and a married woman. She is doing business selling milk to meet her household expenses with the support of her husband. At present, she has two cows and two buffaloes and some calves. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She has four children. She is very motivated to fulfill their needs.

Mumtaz wants to expand her business to meet her household expenses.  She accessed her fourth loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. With this loan amount she will be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 54 years old, a  widow, running a business of milk selling with her son for many years.  She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them  on a daily basis. She is a mother of four children. 

Aysha needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures. In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of Rs.40,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Manimegalai

texts.en:
Manimegalai is a member of a self-help group (SHG), started by the NGO People's Action for Transformation (PAT) in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Kovilsennapuram, a village in Thiruvidaimaruthur Block in Tanjore District. 

Manimegalai wants to buy a smokeless stove with a loan of 1,400 Indian rupees. Greenway Smart Stove is a single-burner high-efficiency cookstove designed for long-term everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, produces 70% less smoke, and uses 65% less fuel than traditional mud cookstoves. Manimegalai wants to save time and money and cook in a healthier environment.

Manimegalai is married and has two children. She studied up to 9th grade. They have 1½ acre of land, and they are farmers. In order to develop the cultivation of their land, they have previously received loans from PAT, and they are regular in repayment. Through microfinance, their standard of life has been improving.

This is Manimegalai first loan with Kiva (and MicroGraam and PAT), and she is looking forward to using this green stove.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a 39-year-old married woman. She has five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals, to generate an extra amount of income.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; recently, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more income for her. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ghulam  Zohra

texts.en:
Ghulam Zohra is a 40-year-old married woman. She started her own business, selling bed sheets and covers, to contribute to her family's income. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family. She buys bundles of bed covers and blankets from the market, then sells to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She earns enough to have a decent life.

She wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demand of her customers, but due to a lack of available funds she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more bed covers, spreads and blankets, in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings with this loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members

loans.use: to buy more bed covers and blankets to sell

loans.name: Malarkodi

texts.en:
Kovilsannapuram is a hamlet in Thiruvidaimaruthur block, Tanjore District. Malarkodi, who has studied up to 10th grade, is living in this village with her husband, Kumar. They have three children.

They do a milk vending business. PAT has given loans to the applicant and they have improved their business and now they have even purchased a cow of their own. They are very prompt in repayment. 

Now Malarkodi wants a loan of INR 1,400 to purchase a smokeless stove to use in her kitchen. She feels this will be very convenient for her in cooking because of less smoke and savings in fuel.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina, a 44-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it, and then sells the clothing to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Rubina has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. This will be Rubina's sixth loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive en su pequeña finca con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en edades de 6 a 15 años. Toda su vida ha estado relacionado a la actividad cafetalera, y desde hace unos 20 años se dedica a la producción de este rubro como principal actividad económica para su familia.

Para este ciclo, este emprendedor está solicitando un crédito para la compra y aplicación de insumos que le permita garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento de su finca y continuar mejorando su productividad de su finca.

Su sueño “es que su familia viva dignamente”, con los ingresos de su finca, y darle a sus hijos una oportunidad de crecer en ambientes confiables y rentables.
texts.en:
Noel is a small coffee producer in the northern zone of Nicaragua. He lives on his small farm with his wife and his five children ages 6 through 15.  All his life he has been associated with coffee production, and for the past 20 years he has worked in this field as his principle job and income for his family.  

For this loan cycle, he is asking for credit to purchase and apply fertilizers that will permit him to guarantee the maintenance activities for his farm and to continue increasing the productivity of his land. 

His dream is that his "family can live in dignity" through the income from his land, and that he can give his children the opportunity to grow in a safe and economically stable environment.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Sarfraz

texts.en:
Sarfraz is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has been in the work of hand-embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Sarfraz has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones, for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to consistently cater to more customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Gowri

texts.en:
Gowri,37, is a married woman living in Kathiramangalam Village in Tanjore District. Her husband is a weaver. She has studied up to 10th grade. They have two children, Sivabalan and Karthick. They are studying in the government school, in 11th and 9th grade, respectively. Gowri is a member of a self-help group that has been receiving loans from the local NGO “PAT” for the last five years.
 
Gowri is now asking a loan from Kiva to purchase a smokeless stove from Greenway. This small loan will be repaid in easy installments.

The Greenway Smart Stove reduces smoke emissions by up to 80%. Users benefit from less coughing, less stinging eyes, less soot on the walls, and big savings on fuel. In the long term, the stove positively affects their health. According to a recent study, household air pollution from open fires kills 4 million people every year and is the No.1 health risk in South Asia.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Geethamary

texts.en:
Geethamary is resident of S.Puthur a small village in Tanjore District. She is married to Yesu and has two children, Tamilselvan and Muzhilmannan. Both of them are studying in elementary school. Geethamary has studied up to 10th grade. Both she and her husband are daily labourers. They earn their livelihood by purchasing coconut leaves to convert into thatches as seen in the picture. They earn approximately INR 6,000 per month, which leaves their family in a poor condition. They have taken a previous loan from the local NGO, “PAT.” 

Geethamary wants to purchase a smokeless stove with a small loan of INR 1,400, which will be repaid in easy installments. The Greenway smart stove is a single burner, high-efficiency cook-stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including, but not limited to, wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. Producing 70% less smoke and using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves, Geethamary will save time and money and provide a healthier environment. This stove has been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Selvarani

texts.en:
Selvarani belongs to a self-help group managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT), which provides microfinance loans. She has been receiving PAT’s support for the last five years. 
   
Selvarani is married and living in Kathiramangalam, a small village in Tanjore District. She has completed fifth grade. Selvarani and her husband own a weaving factory to earn their livelihood. Their monthly income is around about INR 7,000. To improve their business they still receive loans from PAT and repay promptly.

After seeing the demonstration of how the smokeless stove works, Selvarani wants to have one to use in her kitchen through a loan of 1,400 INR which will be repaid in easy installments.

The Greenway Smart Stove reduces smoke emissions by up to 80%. In the long term, it also positively affects users' health. Selvarani is excited about this stove because she will save on fuel and have less smoke in the house.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Leila Hasan

texts.en:
Leila is a 35-year-old, Lebanese married woman, who lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. Leila has been working in the agriculture sector for the past nine years, to help her family to meet the needs of life.

Today she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to improve her business, by purchasing new seeds and seedlings for planting. She will keep on offering the best quality of work ever.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Nariman Afif

texts.en: Nariman is a 25-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and one child. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. She started her own job at an earlier age. She has operated a beauty salon in her house for the last seven years. She has her loyal customers and is glad with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a mirror and chair for her business. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase a mirror and chair for her business

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte desde hace mucho tiempo. Moises es un hombre muy comprometido con su familia y hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila con lavadero y una ducha para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, pegamento, etc. Además, pagará la mano de obra que requiere la construcción.
texts.en:
Moises is 45 years old, he lives in his own home with his wife and for a long time now he has been offering his transportation services for a living. Moises is a man who is very committed to his family and he does everything in his power to give his family better living conditions. 

He has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a concrete washing basin with a sink and shower for which he needs materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, adhesive, etc. In addition, he will pay for the labor costs required for the construction.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand, gravel, adhesive, etc. to build a concrete washing basin with a sink and shower.

loans.name: Zeinab Wahib

texts.en: Zeinab is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five school-aged children. Zeinab works hard to show her determination to improve her family’s way of living. She started her own job by opening a small bakery in her house 10 years ago. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her shop inventory such as flour and oil. She states that the loan will certainly help her extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, Zeinab plans to borrow more loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: To buy more oil and flour

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios, coordinado por la señora María de 30 años y casada se dedica a comercializar cosméticos en su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, cremas, body corporales, pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, rubores, etc., la socia con los créditos ha logrado aumentar la mercadería por lo que sus ganancias han aumentado. Los otros socios son la señora Jenny de 33 años dedicada a la venta de ropa y cosméticos en su domicilio y el señor Alex de 30 años quien brinda el servicio de transporte en su comunidad. El grupo solidario llevan 23 ciclos trabajando en esta institución por lo que han demostrado ser socios responsables y con espíritu de superación.
texts.en:
