This solidarity group consists of three members. The coordinator is Sra. María. She is 30 years old, married, and sells cosmetics in her community. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, body lotions, lipsticks, nail polishes, blushes, and other products. With the loans, María has been able to increase her merchandise and her earnings.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Jenny is 33 years old and sells clothes and cosmetics from her home.
• Sr. Alex, age 30, provides transportation services in his community.

This solidarity group has participated in 23 loan cycles with ADIM. They have demonstrated that they are responsible members and have the spirit to succeed.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, body lotions, lipsticks, nail polishes, blushes, and other products.

loans.name: Jamile Ali

texts.en: Jamile is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman with three children. She has operated a bakery for two years. She is a very hard worker and does not tire of work with the aim of developing it and benefiting from it. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy new merchandise for her business such as oil, flour, knives, etc. to increase productivity and enhance her income. Jamile would like to earn a greater income and she believes that the loan will help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business such as oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Nadine Samih

texts.en: Nadine is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one child. She has worked as a private teacher since 2013. She does this profession because she feels that she is helping students to get the desired education. She prepared a special room in her house where she receives her students. Today, Nadine is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help in her work. She wishes to receive more students in the coming school season.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Alhaji Abass

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Alhaji Abass. He is married and has two children, aged 3 and 7 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because he is responsible for his education. In 2004, Alhaji Abass established his used clothing business. He began his business just to be self-reliant, after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Alhaji Abass requires a loan in order to buy one bale used ladies' blouses. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. In the future, Alhaji Abass plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bale used ladies blouses

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has seven, school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past twelve years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu, to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standard and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Amina still prepares food in her cafe. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, charcoal and beans, for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, charcoal and beans, for her cafe.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married, with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Christine has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the loan, Christine wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie and Preng, who want to use 1/3 of the loan they are requesting from Kiva lenders to pay for their only child’s (daughter) higher education fees, and 2/3 to buy Freze agricultural equipment.

Marie and Preng have pursued agriculture activity for about 24 years now. They live in a very rural village where just like the majority of households they have a vineyard as a source of income and also plant and sell medicinal plants, mostly sage. They own about 5 dynyms (a dynym is 1/10th of a hectare) of agricultural land.

Marie works as a high school teacher. Preng is an agronomist and he does only agriculture. According to him, he loves what he does. Preng mows the sage about four times a year and this is why they need to buy Freze agricultural equipment, to ease his labor.

Kindly note that they have been photographed in their vineyards.

loans.use: to pay for their daughter's higher education fees and buy Freze agricultural equipment

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with one school-going child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar, cooking oil, beans, and flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, beans, and flour for resale.

loans.name: Dinokore Group

texts.en:
The Dinokore (Be Trustful) group is made up of women who live with their families. They are on average 33 years old and have two children. They all live in Dansoman, one of the neighborhoods in Accra. They know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members all work in small-scale commerce selling utensils, maize, cosmetics, slippers, wigs and creams. In order to increase their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana. They are now on their third group loan.

Faustina, who is standing in the middle in the photo, has a good reputation when it comes to selling cooking utensils. She plans to use her loan to buy more cooking utensils from the market to sell to customers. Sales will be made door-to-door.

With this loan, Faustina hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her child.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business selling spices, which are used in food for taste. She purchases spices in bulk from a wholesale market, and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good-quality spices in her locality, and she earns enough to afford a decent life.

She is a responsible mother of four children, and she needs to earn more, to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric, in large quantities. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to use her earned profit on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy spices at wholesale, in large quantities

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 41-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 from Kashf Foundation.  With this loan, she will be able to buy more spools of threads in different colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing her revenues so she is able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her eighth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Tamseela

texts.en: Tamseela is a 35-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia is a 35-year-old lady who has been stitching cloth for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. It will allow her to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and packs of buttons, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Idiatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle IDIATOU est une jeune fille qui tient son destin en main. C'est sa mère qui tenait une gargote et voyant qu'elle vieillie, elle a pris sa place et gère la gargote. Agée de 20ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont le plus agé à 3 ans et le plus petit 1 ans. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans car elle accompagnait toujours sa mère dans la gestion de la gargote. Elle a besoin de ce montant, pour acheter du pain, sucre et diverses denrées alimentaires pour préparer des mets succulents et vendre du petit déjeuner. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 20h. Elle aide son mari aussi dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et souhaite à l'avenir avoir un grand restaurnt au niveau de la ville.
texts.en:
Mademoiselle Idiatou is a young woman who has her destiny well in hand. Her mother used to have a little eatery and as she was growing older, Idiatou took over and runs the eatery. Twenty years old, she is married and the mother of two children of whom the older is 3 and the younger one year old. She has more than five years' experience since she always accompanied her mother in running the eatery. 

Idiatou needs this loan to buy bread, sugar and various foodstuffs to prepare yummy dishes to sell for breakfast. She begins her day at 9 AM and ends it at 9 PM. She also helps her husband cover their daily expenses and she hopes in future to have a big restaurant in town.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, and various foodstuffs and prepare yummy dishes to sell for breakfast

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Donatha is a group leader, age 48. She is married with six children, only five of whom go to school. The group is called Abishyizehamwe Cb Group, meaning “we’re all together.” They sell different things, but they have a common goal of changing their lives for the better. 

Donatha sells foodstuffs and she has spent five years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs, such as beans and sorghum, to sell.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy tiles, cement, sand and other materials to build a toilet and a kitchen sink for family use and pay for labor. Her business goal is to own a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a good life. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, sand and other materials to build a toilet and kitchen sink and pay for labor

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial challenges. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy gas cooker for family use. She hopes that in the future, she will become a better person.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker for family use

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 to 20 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge to be inadequate water. She will use the Kes 18,000 loan to buy a 3000- litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit her six family members. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water

loans.name: Mariam Helmi

texts.en: Mariam is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman with one child. In 2011, she started working from her home as a private teacher to provide her family with extra financial support. She is well known in her region with special talents in her domain. To better improve her job, Mariam is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop. In the future, Mariam plans to borrow more loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: To buy a new laptop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a mother of one school-going child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables and fruits, including tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zawadi has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, two of whom go to school and one who is underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past five years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cereal, such as beans and rice, for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Kerin Ofilio

texts.es:
Kerin, es un joven soltero, vive con sus padres, recién culmino su carrera Universitaria, para iniciar el proceso de independencia y apoyar a sus padres en los gastos familiares, emprendió por cuenta propia su negocio en el que da mantenimiento, realiza reparaciones a computadoras y  tiene a la venta accesorios para las mismas.
Comprará estuche de desatornilladores, alicates, brochas, aspiradora de aire comprimido, mouse, CDS, USB, entre otras herramientas para realizar un buen trabajo y surtir de accesorios el negocio, espera aumentar el número de clientes, tener una rentabilidad estable con la que cumpla el pago de sus cuotas y cubra parte de los gastos familiares.
Su objetivo es tener un buen record crediticio para facilitar el fortalecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Kerin is a single young man who lives with his parents. He recently finished his university degree. In order to start the process of becoming independent and helping his parents with the family expenses, Kerin started his own business so that he could support himself. He repairs computers and also sells accessories for these devices.

Kerin will buy screwdriver kits, pliers, brushes, a portable vacuum, a mouse, CDs, a USB, and other pieces of equipment so that he can do a good job and restock with accessories for his business. He hopes to increase his clientele and achieve stable profitability so that he can complete his payments and cover some of the family expenses.

His goal is to have a good credit record so that he can strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy screwdriver kits, pliers, brushes, a portable vacuum, a mouse, CDs, a USB, and other pieces of equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a supply of basic products to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Daisuri Astrid

texts.es:
Daisuri es una mujer campestre de cultura muy tradicional, vive con sus padres en una humilde finca ubicada en Santa Barbara donde desarrolla diferentes actividades agrícolas.
Hoy en día se dedica a la cría, producción y venta de pollos de engorde en un galpón que construyo a un lado de su casa. Les dedica mucho tiempo y se ha convertido en su principal actividad.
Con este trabajo aporta dinero a su casa y ayuda con la manutención de la misma.
Ella solicita un pequeño aliento económico para capitalizar un poco su negocio comprando más pollos y de esta manera generar más ingresos para ella y su familia.
Sueña con poder consolidar su actividad y hacerla mucho más rentable permitiéndole tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daisuri is a rural woman with very traditional culture. She lives with her parents on a humble farm located in Santa Barbara where she does various agricultural activities.

Today she dedicates to the breeding, production and sale of broiler chicken from a shed that she built at the side of the house. She devotes a lot of time to this and it has become her main activity.The money she earns from her job, she brings home and helps with the maintenance of the home.

She is requesting a small loan to capitalize her business purchasing more chickens and this way generate more income for her and her family.

She dreams of solidifying her activities and making it more profitable so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase broiler chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more phones to resell

loans.name: Women Group

texts.en:
The Women Group is made up of seven members, both single and married mothers who have two children under their care. They are originally from Dansoman, a place that is located in the Greater-Accra region. These members are characterized as being hardworking and responsible with a keen desire to better themselves. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to pursue a degree and were forced to work from a young age to help with the family's outgoings. They are currently fighting every day to give their children a better future.

Mary runs a second hand clothing business as her source of income. She sells at the market. She spends around 12 hours every day at the market selling her goods so that in the not so distant future, she can have a better income. The Women Group is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders are giving people with scarce resources.

Her other colleague sell shoes, jewelry and provisions.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Al- Bina Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Bina. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Hayat is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old single woman living with her family in their own house in Sana'a. She has a university education. Due to the high rates of unemployment in the country, Hayat couldn't find a job in order to look after her family. Hayat didn't surrender to this thing. She decided to work selling women clothes. She found this business profitable for her. Unfortunately, the income of this business is still low, and she wants to improve it. As a result, Hayat asked for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes to resell to the customers in her area. Also, she will use a portion of the loan to purchase a TV for the house.

Hayat looks forward to expanding her business more through purchasing all kinds of women's clothes, accessories, makeup, and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes and resell them

loans.name: Sana Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
Sana Al- Waytat is a group of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Sana is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Her oldest child is eight years old and the youngest one is two years old. She lives with her family in their own house. Their house is a small. Sana's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family.  His income is very low and it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Sana says that her house lacks enough furniture and most of what they have is very old. Unfortunately, they don't have enough money to furnish the house. For this reason, Sana is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bed for the home.

Sana looks forward to improving the living conditions of her family. Her dream in the future is to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances. Also, she hopes to purchase a bedroom for the home.

loans.use: to purchase a bed for her home.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells cosmetics. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 5,960 loan to buy a gas cooker with gas cylinder for family use. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have  a good life.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker with gas cylinder for family use

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells utensils, sandals and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in  a productive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales. 

Patrick will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail business where she sells torches, clothes, caps and other items. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water. 

She will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy a water tank for water storage. This will benefit seven family members. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to access water easily. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Micro-finance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for water storage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy gutters and iron sheets to roof her house

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as humble. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She describes her challenge to be lack of water storage facilities. She will use the KES 78,000 loan to buy a 10,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use and for her restaurant business. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water storage. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 10,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use and for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 16 years. She describes herself as being social and competent. 

Josephine operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family's challenge to be an insufficient water supply in the area where they live. 

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a 3,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy a 3,000 liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: God Is Faithful Group

texts.en:
The God is Faithful group is made up of women who live with their families. They are, on average, 35 years old and have three children. They all live in Dansoman, one of the neighborhoods in Accra. They know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. The group members all work in small-scale commerce selling cream, cloth, jewelry, provisions and drinks. In order to increase their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana. They are now on their sixth group loan.

Mariga, who is standing first from the right in the photo, has a good reputation when it comes to selling jewelry and cloth. She plans to use her loan to buy more jewelry and cloth from the market and sell to customers. Resales will be made at the pavement close to her residence. With this loan, Mariga hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her child. She is married with one dependent child.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and cloth from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste is 35 years old. He is married with two children. He sells different items in his boutique and has spent seven years running the business. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rubaare Tukore Group

texts.en: Rubaare Tukore is a new group located in a town council at Rushenyi, Ntungamo district. It is comprised of men and women whose major activity is retail business and agriculture. They applied for loan through a group. The loan will be shared depending on individual needs. Eunice will use her loan to pay tuition for her two children in lower secondary school. She will use her marginal returns from farming to repay the loan. She thanks the Kiva lenders and her group members for standing by her side. She is committed and hard working.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 45, has two sons and is from the village of Shroma in the Lagodekhi district. One of her sons goes to school and the other works with her on their farm.

Nino works hard to cover the family’s living expenses. She creates dairy products from their cow’s milk and sells it locally. She and her son farm their land and sell its produce. While Nino’s wares are always high quality and fresh, the income derived from them is not stable, so the family requires another way to increase it.

Nino requested and was approved for a 3,000 GEL loan through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, one that gives rural people a chance to start or re-start a business. She will buy clothing and linens at wholesale prices and start trading them among her villagers. This will give her a chance to tackle financial difficulties and give her sons a good education so they can progress in life. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and linens to sell

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Foday.  He is married, and has two children aged seven and four years old. One is a school going child. In 2012, Foday established his building material business. He began his business because he was trained in business and that is why he decided to set up his own to provide a livelihood and develop his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 8,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Foday requires a loan in order to buy more building materials (cement, paints, and floor mats). In the future, Foday plans to improve his business and educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more building materials (cement, paint, and floor mats)

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a  Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand business. 

Peris will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will benefit from the loan. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro-finance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 54-year-old mother of three, describes herself to be honest. For 10 years now she has operated a farm where she grows tea. Her business is in a fertile location. and her primary customers are large scale purchasers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather. 

Mary will use this Kes 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will do large-scale farming. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance bank, her previous loan having been fully repaid.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Hayati Al-Waitat Group

texts.en:
Hayat, 33, is the leader of this group named Hayati Al-Waitat. It is comprised of four women from Sana'a, Yemen who are applying for a 140,000 YER loan from AMB to be split among themselves. Hayat herself is a housewife, uneducated yet enterprising and dynamic. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family.

Hayat’s kitchen has no refrigerator. Because they can’t stay cool, some beverages spoil. For this reason the house needs a refrigerator to keep everything in a good and cold condition. Hayat will use 40,000 YER from the loan to buy one.

Hayat wishes to give her family a better future. She hopes to see the second floor of the house completed someday.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Stoung district of Kampong Thom province, Then is a 23-year-old married woman with two children who are dependent on her. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and fishing, which they have been doing for five years. The current business earns their family about 25,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan cycle for Then with VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fishing tools. With this loan, she hopes to make more income to improve her family's standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fishing tools

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery tiene 47 años, casada con dos hijos ya mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos o especias, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Rosmery  va a usar este préstamo para compra de condimentos al por mayor como ajo al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Rosmery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  sus especias y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Rosmery is 47 years old, married with two grown children. She works in selling condiments or spices, and she sells hers products in different markets in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her first sequence in the institution, and Rosmery is going to use this loan to buy condiments at wholesale like garlic and stock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise. Rosmery faces challenges in her business like competition, and she is going to utilize the benefits in continuing to buy her spices and generate more income in that way. She feels happy and appreciative for the opportunity that is afforded her to increase her business, improve her income and therefore the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale condiments like garlic.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 28-year-old farmer, who lives in a rural community in one of the poorest states of Mexico. Sergio will use this loan to buy 6 head of cattle for expanding and replacing his livestock.

He will develop a more sustainable cattle-raising method through a silvopasture system for breeding and fattening steers. His goal is to save money, increase his production and sell cattle to other farmers in the area, fostering economic activity in the community.

Sergio has been working with an NGO to obtain the technical expertise and has built the necessary infrastructure to develop the silvopasture system. This project will improve the living conditions of his family and will contribute to the conservation of a high environmental value area.

loans.use: to buy 6 head of cattle to develop a sustainable farming ecosystem

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar de 64 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas. Día a día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y tener frescos y listos los ingredientes que le permiten hacer sus deliciosas pupusas. Tiene mucha clientela ya que cuando de pupusas se trata ella tiene las mejores y con los precios más accesibles. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer de manera que pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida. Piensa invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, arroz, chicharon, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pilar is 64 years old and prepares and sells delicious pupusas [stuffed tortillas] for a living. Every day she gets up very early to go to the market so she has the ingredients fresh and ready to make her tasty pupusas. She has many customers because when it comes to pupusas, she has the best and most affordable ones around.

She has decided to take out a loan from Integral to invest in her business because her dream is to see it grow in such a way that her quality of life would improve. She is planning to spend the loan on raw ingredients that she needs, such as corn, rice, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. In this way, she hopes to fulfill her dream and be able to give her family a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 25 years old. She is married with one child. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. 

She is very happy with the previous loans, which helped her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pesticides and diseases. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and medicine. 

Her business goal is to be a supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a millionaire. 

She will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi, 35 ans, est un revendeur qui dispose d’une baraque pour son commerce. Il est marié à une coiffeuse avec laquelle il a eu un enfant. Kossi fait dans le prêt à porter et  avec les revenus qu'il tire de ses ventes, il prend soin  de la maison et projette prendre  une partie pour ouvrir une boutique avec une belle vitrine. Ce  prêt contribuera à améliorer  l’image de son commerce et à obtenir ainsi de meilleurs revenus.
texts.en:
Kossi, 35 years old, is a retailer who has a stall for his business. He is married to a hairdresser with whom he has one child.

Kossi works in ready-to-wear and, with the income he receives from his sales, he takes care of the house and plans to take part [of the profits] to open a shop with a lovely window. This loan will help improve his business' image and [he] will thus bring in a higher income.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear [clothing].

loans.name: Pagb Tarpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est responsable de groupe PAGB TARPANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé 10ans, le moins âgé 20jours. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales et des fourneaux depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les vendeurs en gros.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de maïs, 01sac de sorgho et un sac de petit mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut accroitre son activité. Mme ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is the leader of Pagb Tarpanga Group. Married, she is the mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 10 years old and the youngest of whom is 20 days old. Two [of her children] attend school.

Mrs. Aminata has been selling grains and stoves for 10 years. She gets her supplies from wholesalers. She wants to purchase one sack of corn, one sack of sorghum, and one sack of pearl millet.

With her profits, Mrs. Aminata wants to expand her business. Her goal is to build a house in which to live.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of corn, one sack of sorghum, and one sack of pearl millet.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be an independent business person. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.en:
Blandine is 42 years old. She is married with one child. 

She runs a décor store and has a variety of gowns for brides and suits for men. She has requested the loan for buying more gowns and suits for sale and hire for weddings and ceremonial events. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for the better future of the business.

loans.use: to buy more gowns and suits for hire and sale.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es:
Donald es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una zona productiva de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, todos estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. Este hombre alegre y motivador tiene más de 20 años de trabajar produciendo café, el cual maneja ahora bajo el proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo, él está requiriendo un crédito para la compra de insumos que demanda su plantación de café para un adecuado mantenimiento. Con esta inversión, está seguro obtendrá una buena cosecha y con ello mejores ingreso para su familia.

Su sueño es heredar a sus hijos un futuro prometedor, y está seguro que el café es un rubro que tiene gran potencial para alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en:
Donald is a small coffee grower who lives in a productive area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and four children, all of whom study at a school in their community. This cheerful and charismatic man has been producing coffee for more than 20 years, which he now does with Fair Trade certification.

For this cycle he needs a loan so he can buy supplies that are necessary for proper maintenance of his coffee fields. He is confident that the loan will ensure a good harvest and consequently, better income for his family. His dream is to leave his children a promising future, and he is sure that coffee is an area with great potential to realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy supplies for application to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 19 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hermanos y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 1 año, comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por que vende a buen precio y sus productos son de muy buena calidad, la clienta solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y seguir con su negocio que es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder seguir ayudando en su casa en los gastos que se les presentan y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client, who is 19 years old, lives in her own house with her two brothers and their mother. She has been dedicated to selling clothing and shoes as of one year ago. She sells as a street vendor through the different markets that are found close to her place of residence. She has a large clientele because she sells at a fair price and her product is very good quality. 

The client is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more bulk merchandise and to continue with her business, which is her only source of work. This way she is able to continue helping around with the house with the costs that they are presented, and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more bulk merchandise.

loans.name: Kobekoun Group

texts.fr:
Kobekoun est un regroupement de femmes du  quartier Koko de Koutiala qui   vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que de Bois de chauffe, Soumbala, d’arachide et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe. 
Ozo debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche est une vendeuse de bois de chauffe.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des chargements de bois de chauffe dans les brousses environnantes  de Koutiala. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à la maison et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kobekoun comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Ozo  compte réaliser  115 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Kobekoun is a women’s group from the Koko neighborhood in Koutiala. The women live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are on average 42 years old, and are all married with at least five children.

This group of women trades in various items such as firewood, soumbala (a condiment), ground nuts, etc. To grow their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. This is their eleventh group loan.

Ozo, the second woman standing from the right, sells firewood. She is planning on using her loan to purchase firewood gathered from the bush around Koutiala as it becomes available. She retails cash or credit, from home, to a varied clientele.

While the other members of group Kobekoun are expecting an average monthly profit of 100,000 XOF each for this cycle, Mrs. Ozo is forecasting 115,000 XOF.

In addition to paying back the loans, they use part of their profits to pay for personal expenses and to increase their working capital.

They hope to consolidate this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to prevent low stocks.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Hassan. He is married and has three children, aged 15, 7 and 4 years. One of them is a school-going child. 

In 1999, Hassan established his building materials business (paint, toilet seats, nails, hammers, stabilizers, and locks). He began his business because he was trained in business; that is why he decided to set up his own business to develop his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hassan requires a loan in order to purchase more building materials. 

In the future, Hassan plans to improve his business and his family status. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more building materials.

loans.name: Ruby Liliana

texts.es:
Ruby es una mujer emprendedora y pujante, desde hace aproximadamente 6 años inicio con un taller de confecciones en contratación con terceros con el cual ha podido sacar a su familia adelante.
Ella aprendió de este oficio tomando clases en diferentes academias y posteriormente realizo sus prácticas en una fábrica de confección; de allí decidió montar su propio taller buscando independencia y poder estar más pendiente de sus hijos.
Actualmente genera dos empleos y quiere aumentar su nivel de producción comprando una maquina recubridora con la cual podrá realizar sus trabajos de manera mucho más rápida y generando así mayores ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es poder fortalecer su negocio, generar más empleo, seguir capacitándose y tener línea propia.
texts.en:
Ruby is an entrepreneurial and thriving woman. As of approximately 6 years ago she began a clothing shop in contracting with third parties with which she has been able to get her family ahead. 

She learned this position by taking classes in different schools and later carried out her practices in a clothing factory; from there she decided to build her own store, searching for independence and to be able to look after her children. 

She currently generates two businesses and wants to build on her level of production, buying a sewing machine with which she will be able to carry out her tasks in a much more rapid fashion, and this way generating better income.

Her greatest dream is to be able to strengthen her business, generate more work, continue qualifying herself, and to have her own clothing line.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Narciso Isabel

texts.es:
Narciso es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En los últimos tres años la producción de café en su finca se ha incrementado. El dice que la actividad del café es gratificante “hace presencia en nuestros hogares y lo mejor es su aporte a la economía.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, y asegurar una buena cosecha para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Se considera una persona activa y con mucha energía, la cual invierte para brindar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Narciso is a small coffee producer who lives is a rural community north of Nicaragua.  Over the last three years, coffee production on his farm has increased.  He says that the work is gratifying because it “creates a presence in our homes and the best part is its contribution to the economy”. For this loan cycle, he is requesting a loan that will permit him to purchase inputs and fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantation, ensure a good harvest, and improve conditions for his family.  He considers himself an active person with lots of energy, which he invests in providing his children with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase needed inputs and fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier vive en una pequeña comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Desde pequeño ha estado relacionado a la actividad de café y por más de 15 años esta ha sido su principal actividad económica. Junto a esposa y sus 3 hijos que van a la escuela de su comunidad, atienden las diferentes actividades de finca. 

Inició con poca área, pero ahora ha logrado tener 1.5 hectáreas de café. La administración adecuada de los recursos dice que ha sido clave para esto. Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos que le permitan continuar mejorando los rendimientos de su café y sus ingresos. 

Para este pequeño productor, su deseo de brindar a su familia una vida más digna lo motiva a seguir trabajando y teniendo disposición al cambio para mejorar el manejo de su finca.
texts.en:
Javier lives in a small community in the northern part of Nicaragua. Ever since he was young his work has been related to coffee, and it has been his main source of income for more than 15 years. Together with his wife and three children who go to the community school, Javier takes care of the various farm chores. He started with just a small plot of land, but today he has managed to expand to 1.5 hectares of coffee. He says that careful oversight of his resources has been key to his growth.

For this cycle he is requesting a loan so he can buy supplies that will allow him to continue to increase his coffee yield and his income. For this small producer, his desire to provide his family a more dignified life is what motivates him to continue working and to be willing to make changes to better manage his farm.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts from Europe for retail.

loans.name: Rio Cayapas Group

texts.es:
MARIA.  Inicia actividades de compra venta de madera hace más de un año, ella compra la madera a las personas de la comunidad Chachi y comunidades cercanas  en Pichiyacu Grande y la comercializa en Borbón. Donde la puede ofertar en un buen precio.
MARIA. Tiene 2 hijos. Varón de 1 mes y una niña de 3 años; vive con su esposo quien es jornalero (corta madera en el bosque hasta convertirla en tablas). María tiene ya su clientela en este negocio y la va muy bien.
En su comunidad tienen una iglesia, tienen un centro de salud y una pequeña escuela. Todos los integrantes del grupo se conocen desde siempre y se han caracterizado por ser responsables y participativos. 
MARIA. Está segura de que en menos de tres años podrá implementar otro tipo de negocio (tienda de alimentos) y continuar mejorando el negocio de la compra venta de madera.
MARIA en su tiempo libre practica mucho el futbol femenino.
Ella agradece mucho la gestión que hace FODEMI al entregar créditos a personas de bajos recursos que viven en extrema pobreza y se les brinda la oportunidad de transformar su vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria began buying and selling wood more than one year ago.  She buys the wood from people in the community of Chachi and from the communities near Pichiyacu Grande, and she sells it in Borbón where she can get a good price. Maria already has some regular customers and her business is going well.

Maria has two children: a boy who is one month old; and a girl who is three years old. She lives with her husband who is a day laborer (he cuts wood in the forest to make into planks). Their community has a church, a health center, and a small school. All the members of the group have known each other their entire lives, and are responsible and actively engaged.

Maria is sure that in less than three years she will be able to start another type of business (a food store) and continue improving her business of buying and selling wood. In her free time Maria plays a lot of women's soccer.

She is very grateful to FODEMI for their work in providing loans to people of limited financial resources who live in extreme poverty. These loans give them the opportunity to transform their lives and those of their children.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of wood.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 38 años y desde hace más de quince años se dedica a la producción de café en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la finca  de 13 y 15 años los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.

Su pequeña finca la maneja bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, lo cual muestra el espíritu emprendedor y social de esta familia. En los últimos tres años su producción de café ha aumentado de un 30%, lo cual está segura puede mejorar si obtiene un crédito para la compra de materiales e insumos que necesita aplicar a su plantación de 2.6 hectáreas de café.

Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es producir café de mayor calidad y alto rendimiento, y heredar a sus hijos además de sus estudios, el amor por el trabajo, lo cual está segura logrará gracias a su espíritu innovador.
texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and has been producing coffee in a northern community of Nicaragua for more than 15 years. She lives with her husband and their two children on the plantatation. Her children are 13 and 15 years old and study in the local school.

She manages her small plantation under certification of Fair Trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E. practices, which demonstrates the entrepreneurial and social spirit of her family. In the past three years her coffee production has increased 30%. She is confident she can improve even more if she receives a loan to buy materials and supplies needed for planting the 2.6 acres of coffee.

Her greatest wish for the future is to produce higher quality coffee with a higher yield, and pass on to her children not only their education, but the love of work, which is sure to be achieved thanks to her innovative spirit.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Soso Group

texts.en:
Soso is a group consisting of three women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is the leader of the group. She is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, and lives with them in a simple house in a poor area. Maryam is uneducated, but she is a very dynamic woman and has a strong determination. She decided to help her husband with the family expenses and began selling cosmetics and accessories door to door. Maryam couldn't earn good profits from this business, so she decided to change her business to sell ice cream in the streets. She sees this business as profitable for her. Unfortunately, she doesn't have a refrigerator for the ice cream. For this reason, Maryam is requesting 40,000 YER  as her portion of the loan from AMB to purchase a refrigerator to keep the ice cream cold.

Maryam looks forward to opening a small shop for selling sambusa (a traditional food) and chips. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep ice cream cold

loans.name: Nueva Vision Group

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es madre de tres hijos dos de ellos estudian en nivel superiores y el tercero en el colegio. La señora Gladys se dedica a la venta por catalogo desde hace 3 años. Es socia del grupo “Nueva Visión” Ella no es el único sustento de su familia ya que su conjugue la apoya  con los gastos del hogar.
Ella ofrece productos por catálogos 10 horas tres veces por semana y dice que se siente muy orgullosa de lo que hace, La señora piensa invertir el dinero  del crédito que le otorgo EDAPROSPO para la compra de productos de belleza como colonias, cremas, joyas y una vitrina que piensa comprar para poner ahí los productos que ofrecerá. Hasta poder poner su stand. El sueño de esta madre es tener más de un puesto de venta. Y así darles una mejor calidad de vida y estudios a sus tres hijos.
La señora se siente feliz de pertenecer al grupo y de recibir la confianza de las otras socias. Ella solo tiene palabras de agradecimiento para los inversionistas extranjeros como KIVA y les desea mucha suerte en su labor y les pide no dejen de ayudar a gente que necesita.
texts.en:
Gladys is the mother of three children, two of whom are in high school, and the third is in elementary school.  For three years, Gladys has been engaged in catalog sales.  She is a member of the “Nueva Visión” group.  She is not the family’s sole source of support because her spouse helps her with the household expenses. 

Gladys sells her products ten hours a day, three times per week, and says that she feels very proud of what she does.  She plans to invest the money from the loan granted though Edaprospo in the purchase of beauty products such as cologne, cream, and jewelry.  She also plans to purchase a glass case in which to place the products that she will offer until she is able to set up her stand.  This mother’s dream is to have more than one stand and thus, provide her three children with a better quality of life and an education.

Gladys feels happy to belong to the group and receive trust from the other members.  She only has words of thanks for the foreign investors such as Kiva, and wishes them much luck in their work and asks them not to stop helping people in need.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cream, cologne, and a glass case to set up her business.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Siguidia est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 39ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 6 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de tissus, restauration, Savon, Bois de chauffage  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Niagaly est un membre du groupe Siguidia assise au bout et à droite, elle est vendeuse de bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des chargements de bois de chauffage dans les brousses environnantes  de Koutiala. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à la maison et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Siguidia comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Niagaly compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Siguidia is a women’s group from Koutiala. The women know one another well, and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They are on average 39 years old, and are all married with at least six children.

This group of women trades in various items such as fabrics, food, soap, firewood, and so on. To grow their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. This is their second group loan.

Niagaly, the woman sitting all the way to the right in the picture, is a member of group Siguida. She retails firewood. She is planning on using her loan to purchase firewood gathered from the bush around Koutiala as it becomes available. She retails cash or credit, from home, to a varied clientele.

While the other members of group Siguidia are expecting an average monthly profit of 105,000 XOF each for this cycle, Mrs. Ozo is forecasting 120,000 XOF.

In addition to paying back the loans, they use part of their profits to pay for personal expenses and to increase their working capitals.

They hope to consolidate this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to prevent low stocks.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a transport business, transporting goods using his cart. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a vibrant location, and his customers are all types of people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk (motorcycle taxi) within five years. This is Augustine's second loan with SMEP microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive sells clothes. She is single and takes care of two children between the ages of 4 and 10. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits from the business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, a 25-year-old single man, sells a variety of merchandise in his boutique. He is requesting this loan to buy more sugar, rice and soap for resale. Charles will reinvest his profits in his store.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hardware items

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a new client, aged 36 years old, who runs a retail shop in a rural area. He wishes to expand his shop but is limited by resources. He has come to UGAFODE for a loan, hoping that it can change his standard of living and that of his family. His challenge is little turnover in his business, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a 1,500,000 UGX loan to expand his stock by buying household items. Willy is hard-working.

Pictured is the credit officer (right), Willy and his wife.

loans.use: To buy household items to stock his shop

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: A sus 45 años Alfredo se dedica ya  35 años a trabajar en una mecánica general y ahora ya tiene su negocio propio, el es casado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno asiste al colegio,  otro a la universidad y el mayor es casado,  Alfredo va a invertir el crédito en la compra de  herramienta manual para su mecánica y de esta manera dar mejor atención y atraer más  clientes para que sus ingresos se mejoren y dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 45 years old, Alfredo has been working as a general mechanic for 35 years, and now he has his own business. He is married and has three children, one of whom is in high school, one goes to university, and the eldest is married.

Alfredo will invest the money from the loan to purchase hand tools for his mechanic shop, attracting more customers and increasing his income so his children can continue to study.

loans.use: to buy machinery for his auto mechanic work.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis reside en una ciudad pequeña donde compra quesos y luego se traslada a otra ciudad donde existe un mercado más amplio y  vende sus quesos los fines de semana para obtener una ganancia, a este negocio se dedica desde hace 3 años, también trabaja de albañil cuando le contratan y lo llevan a lugares muy lejanos de donde no puede regresar a su hogar por algún tiempo, Luis es casado y vive con sus 4 hijos, de los cuales tres asisten a la escuela y el de 2 años pasa en la casa con su mamá, Luis va a invertir el crédito en la compra de quesos   para revenderlos, Luis es un hombre tranquilo que aspira mejorar su negocio para dedicarse más tiempo a la venta de quesos y pasar junto a su familia y seguir luchando por sus hijos.
texts.en: Luis lives in a small city. There he buys cheeses and then heads to another city. This other city has a larger market and it is there that he sells the cheeses at the weekends for a profit. Luis has been had this business for three years. He also works as a contract builder, which takes him to places too far from his home that he can return at night. Luis is marred and lives with his four children. Three of his children are at school while the youngest - two years old - stays at home with his mum. Luis will invest this loan in buying cheeses. Luis is a quiet man who aspires to do better at his business. He wants to spend more time selling cheeses, spend time with his family, and to continue fighting for his children.

loans.use: to buy cheeses.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto, en una casa de adobe donde también viven sus padres Marco sobrevive como chofer de transporte público y necesita un credito para  pagar el mantenimiento de su movilidad Marco es la unica persona que trabaja en su hogar, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Marco is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in El Alto , in a house built with adobe bricks. Marco makes a living as a public transport driver. He needs a loan in order to maintain his vehicle. Marco is the only one in his household who earns a living, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella vive en El Alto. En una casa de adobe donde paga un anticretico a la vez que hace de cuidadora de la propiedad  Julia es carnicera  y necesita un credito para comprar carne de res para incrementar sus ventas. Julia es por el momento la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Julia is married with four children, and lives in El Alto in an adobe house under an “anticrético” [a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent] and she is caretaker of the property at the same time.  Julia is a butcher and needs a loan to purchase beef to increase her sales.  For the time being, Julia is the only source of income in her household and, for this reason, she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase beef for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel se dedica a la venta materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, arena, piedra, calaminas, fierros y también alquila dormitorios. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Angel works selling construction materials, such as cement, sand, stone, corrugated iron, metal, and he also rents out rooms. He has been selling construction materials for several years. He is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his job. He is an enterprising and hard-working individual who is a member of the communal bank "Paititi".

This time, he needs the loan to buy materials, such as cement. He is thankful and appreciative for the loan, and he is committed to make the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as cement.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: Silvio es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe  junto a sus familiares Silvio es costurero y quiere un prestamo para comprar una maquina de cocer Silvio es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar y por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Silvio is a single man with no children.  He lives in El Alto in an adobe home with his family.  He is a tailor and wants a loan to purchase a sewing machine.  Silvio is the only source of income in his home and, for this reason, he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en: Simeon is a married man with three children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells soap, cooking fat, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of soap, cooking fat, rice and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a good life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap, cooking fat, rice and other items

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Rugiatu, a married mother of three children aged 15, 10, and 8 years. In 1998, Rugiatu established her charcoal business to assist her husband in the running of the home and to assist family issues. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month. 

Rugiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000’000 to purchase 300 bags of charcoal and pay for their delivery. In the future, she plans to build her own dwelling house, construct a bigger shop and give quality education to the children. 

Rugiatu is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her enterprise so that she can save enough for her retirement. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 300 bags of charcoal and pay for the transportation of the charcoal.

loans.name: Darwin Patricio

texts.es: Patricio es un joven de 25 años, vive con su esposa e hija de 5 años que asiste a la escuela, empezó con el negocio de  venta de ropa desde hace un año atrás cuando Fodemi le dio el primer crédito, también se dedica a trabajar en la mecánica de su padre,  su esposa trabaja de vendedora en un almacén, Patricio va a invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería en ropa y aspira poder ampliar su negocio y en algún momento ponerse un almacén todo por beneficio de su esposa e hija.
texts.en: Patricio is 25 years old and lives with his wife and five-year-old daughter, who is in school. Patricio started a business selling clothes one year ago when "FODEMI" gave him his first loan. He also works at his father's garage. Patricio's wife is a saleswoman in a large store. Patricio will invest this loan in buying more clothes to sell. He aspires to expanding his business and, one day, setting up a large store to look after his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, cinco hijos y una nieta. Ella se se dedica a la venta de tamales y su esposo se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte desde hace mucho tiempo. Hilda solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar el piso de la vivienda con el fin de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a sus hijos. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena.
texts.en: Hilda is 38 years old and lives with her husband, five children, and one granddaughter in their own home.  She sells tamales and her husband provides transportation services and has been doing so for a long time.  Hilda is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, so she can improve the floor in her house to provide better living conditions for her children.  She will use the money to buy tiles, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to install a floor in her home.

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS GERANIOS” está conformado por socias trabajadoras y empeñosas en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Crecencia tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a su bodega que implemento en su vivienda con la finalidad de dedicarse más tiempo a sus hijos y la vez apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. Ella desea ampliar su bodega es por eso que el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas y productos no perecibles para su bodega. El grupo  agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Crecencia es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo celeste.
texts.en: The “LOS GERANIOS” group is made up of hardworking and striving women who want to improve their families’ quality of life.  Crecencia is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage and has two dependent children.  She has a shop that she set up in her home so she could spend more time with her children and also help her husband with the household expenses.  She wants to expand her store and will use the money from this loan to buy beverages and perishable products.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Crecencia is the third person from the right, wearing a sky blue polo top.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es: Yenny es soltera pero vive con una persona, la pareja tiene un hijo. Yenny vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe donde paga un alquiler Yenny es costurera y el esfuerzo que realiza le daña la vista. Por eso Yenny necesita un prestamo para comprar una maquina recta y poder desempeñar de mejor manera su labor con su pareja que tambien es costurero y aparece junto a ella en la fotografia de esta solicitud
texts.en: Yenny is single but living with someone; the couple has a son.  She lives in El Alto, in an adobe home where she pays rent.  She is a seamstress and the work that she is doing hurts her eyes.  For this reason, Yenny needs a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine and be better able to perform her work with her partner, who is also a tailor, and appears next to her in this application’s photograph.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: En Arjona, un municipio donde la producción de bollos, o amasijos de maíz y la preparación de quesos, entre otros alimentos, suelen ser parte de la economía doméstica, habita Lucia, quien aprovecha sus habilidades culinarias y comerciales,  para vender alimentos, y mercancías variadas, con las que genera  ingresos para sostener sus dos pequeños hijos; su idea de negocio nació, hace 4 años, cuando sintió la necesidad de producir bienestar para ellos, e inició comercializando productos alimentarios, preparados por ella misma, los que poco a poco le dieran la posibilidad de construir su pequeño mercado de clientes. Hoy vende de contado y a crédito, queso, paletas, pasteles, minutos a celulares y productos de belleza. Entre sus principales clientes estan sus vecinos y los amigos que le recomiendan otros compradores. Su meta es tener una tienda de gran tamaño y para ello se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para iniciar su crecimiento mediante la posibilidad de obtener un credikiva,   financiamiento que invertirá en  comprar queso en mayor volumen y también insumos alimentarios como arroz, verduras, carnes, aceites etc, con los cuales elaborar pasteles. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues aumentará su producción y así mismo impactará sus ventas, para con sus utilidades capitalizar su negocio y hacerlo crecer mucho más, porque su principal desafío es lograr ahorrar efectivamente y ella reconoce que debe trabajar mucho.
texts.en: Lucia lives in Arjona, a town where corn buns, dough, cheeses, and other things are produced and that is part of the national economy.  Lucia uses her culinary and business abilities to sell food and merchandise to generate income to support her two young children.  Her idea for the business was born four years ago when she felt the need to improve their wellbeing.  She started selling food that she prepared herself and little by little she was able to build a small group of customers.  Now she sells cheese, popsicles, cakes, cell phone cards, and beauty products for cash and credit.  Her main customers include her neighbors and friends who recommend her to other customers.  Her goal is to have a large store so she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy cheese and ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, etc. in quantity, which she will use to make cakes.  Her business will improve through this investment and her production will increase, as will her sales, and she will be able to improve and grow her business.  Her biggest challenge is to save effectively and she knows that she must work hard.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Beatriz Marlene

texts.es: La Señora  Beatriz  tiene 49 años, es casada,  ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo en su puesto de venta en la zona de La Mutualista de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución. La Señora  Beatriz va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como abarrotes y verduras para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora  Beatriz necesita el efectivo ya que comprando por mayor sale más baratos los insumos y así poder ahorrar algo, la Señora  Beatriz  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  y transportar la misma hasta su puesto de venta,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida donde pueda elaborar y vender sus riquísimos platillos y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en: Beatriz is 49 years old and married. She works selling food and lunch at her food stall in the area of La Mutualista in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is in its first cycle with the institution. Beatriz will use this loan to buy inputs such as groceries and vegetables that she needs to prepare her delicious dishes.
