She began her business because she lost her father at an early age and had no one to take care of her and her mother. This led her to start a business in order to take care of herself and her mother. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more stationery items like A4 papers, ledger books, and files covers. In the future, Zainab plans to build her own dwelling house, build a bigger shop and give a quality education to the children. She is looking forward to the funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will save enough for her children’s schooling. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery items like papers, ledger books, and files covers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 7 to 19 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are frequent. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of eggs. She hopes that in the future, she will have frequent cash flow. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 23 years old. She sells various items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk, mineral water, and juices for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house. She is very happy with the previous loan, which helped much in expanding her business volume.

loans.use: to buy milk, mineral water, and juices for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, pepper, and bitter ball for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, pig feet, and fish for her business.

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su familia integrada por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 26 y 21 años de edad, siendo un jovencito aprendió de su padre a cultivar granos básicos y la comercialización de ganado, su negocio funciona desde hace 20 años, la jornada de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., sus ventaja es que cuanta con muchos clientes.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar una vaquilla, fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas y semilla, fortalecerá el negocio y tendrá los insumos agrícolas básicos para sembrar maíz, espera mejorar su producción y con los nuevos ingresos cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Su visión es continuar trabajando para incorporar otro rubro que le permita tener una mejor economía para ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and their two children of 21 and 26 years of age. As a child he learned about selling cattle from his father and how to cultivate basic grains. His business has been operating for 20 years with a workday from 8:00am to 5:00pm. Having many customers is his advantage.

He will use the loan to buy a heifer, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, seed, to strengthen the business and to have the basic agricultural inputs to plant corn. He expects to improve production and to pay off the incurred debt with the new income.

His vision is to continue working to incorporate another line of work that enables him to have more income to offer his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used bedding, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her vegetable and basic grain crop.

loans.name: Rosario Alexandra

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer joven euatoriana de 32 años, está actualmente casada con Cristian quien tiene 33 años , gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la secundaria  y luego  la falta de recursos económicos la llevó a trabajar desde muy chica para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, ella también cuida de su casa y sus hijos ya que su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad, ahora Rosario vive con sus hijos y su esposo en la ciudad de Latacunga, en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro del cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi. 
Rosario es una comerciante de ropa por vario años en esta actividad, trabaja los fines de semana y los días que tiene libre, ya que además trabaja en un almacén de ropa de bebé. 
Rosario con la experiencia que ha adquirido a través de los años y experimentando el crecimiento que ha tenido su negocio se siente preparada para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en el incremento de mercadería nueva y por temporada del día de La Madre y espera que esto pueda mejorar sus estilo de vida y el de su familia, dándoles un mejor futuro.   
Rosario y su esposo agradecen a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young 32-year-old Ecuadorian woman. She is currently married to Cristian, who is 33. Thanks to her parents' hard work, she was able to finish high school. Then, lack of economic resources caused her to work from a very young age to provide for herself. Despite having a job that demands much time and effort, she also takes care of her house and children because her husband works outside of the city. Rosario lives with her children and husband in the city of Latacunga, in the Eloy Alfaro parish, in the Latacunga canton, located in the province of Cotopaxi.
Rosario has been a clothing merchant for several years. She works weekends and also when she has free days; she also works at a baby clothing store.
Rosario, through the experience she has acquired from several years, is experiencing growth in her business. She therefore feels prepared to take a step to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan which she will use to increase her new merchandise for the Mothers' Day season. She hopes that this will improve her and her family's lifestyle, and give them a better future.
Rosario and her husband thank Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making this growth in their work and personal lives possible.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Nilda Teresa

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar colonias, pefumes.
La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business selling beauty products. The member has engaged in this work for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. The member wants to continue working because in this way she continues supporting her family.

The member needs the loan to purchase colognes and perfumes.

The member  is happy with the loan she received and is committed to making her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to purchase colognes and perfumes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking fat and rice and pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to own a large shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat and rice and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business,

loans.name: Kokouvi Mawinasso

texts.fr: Kokouvi est un jeune homme marié de 34 ans. Il est papa d’un jeune enfant de 5 ans. Kokouvi est photographe de profession  et dispose d’un petit studio qu’il a emménagé  dans un coin de sa maison. Il a démarré son activité depuis 2006. Soucieux de l’avenir de son couple,Kokouvi ne ménage pas son quotidien. Il travaille sans relâche. IL est spécialisé dans les reportages, dans les tournages de vidéo et dans la photographie. C’est dans le cadre de son travail, qu’il sollicite un troisième prêt de WAGES pour l’achat d’un ordinateur pour l’impression des photos. Avec ses années d’expérience, Kokouvi a pu fidéliser ses clients .Dans l’avenir, il prévoit prendre un vrai studio digne de ce nom pour conquérir le marché.
texts.en: Kokouvi is a young man, 34 years old, who is a dad wtih a young child, 5 years old. Kokouvi is a photographer by profession and has a small studio he has set up in a corner of his house. He started his business in 2006. Concerned about the future, Kokouvi works hard ever day, tirelessly. He is a specialist in reporting, filming videos, and photography. For these aspects of his work, he is requesting a third WAGES loan to purchase a computer for photographic printing. With his years of experience, Kokouvi was able to earn the loyalty of his customers. For the future, he plans on having a real studio worthy enough to conquer the market.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for photographic printing

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ludovina is one of the members of the group called Trabajando para el Futuro 1, 3 & 4 (Working for the Future), located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and fruits, and who also provide services including a beauty salon. 

Ludovina is a businesswoman who lives with her three children and her long-term partner. She tells us that her greatest challenge is helping her children to grow and become professionals. She is very excited to receive her 21th loan with Esperanza Internacional, which she will invest in her business inventory by buying food such as rice, vegetables, fruits, meat, and other products, for her food market. Ludovina runs her business from her house, located in one of the rural communities in Samana. 

Ludovina has had her business for about 12 years. She started it with her first loan with Esperanza. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy groceries and food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, like rice, palm oil, fish, tomatoes and onions, to be able to cook larger quantities of rice and sauce to sell

loans.name: Lattou Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGUIRATOU représente le groupe  LATTOU. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgée a 14ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 02 sacs de petit mil, 05sacs de maïs, 03 sacs d’arachides et 01 sac d’haricot.
Avec  ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne ouvrir son propre magasin de stockage.
texts.en:
Ms. AGUIRATOU represents the group LATTOU. She is doing fine. A married woman, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 3. Two go to school. 

Ms. AGUIRATOU has been selling grains for three years. She gets her supplies from the surrounding villages. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of millet, 5 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of peanuts, and a sack of beans. With the profits, she wants to bolster her business. Her ambition is to open her own warehouse.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of millet, 5 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of peanuts, and a sack of beans

loans.name: Jaime Saúl

texts.en:
Jaime is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

Jaime is 38 years old, single, has no economic dependents and lives in a house he owns. He makes a living selling regional food he brings from the southern Mexican state of Oaxaca, his birthplace.

Jaime visits his clients door-to-door offering these Oaxacan products, such as mole, different cheeses, chocolates, meat and tamales. He travels around in his car visiting the clients he already knows and new ones who are referred to him.

Jaime asks for this loan to buy merchandise for his business, especially since he can only buy it when he travels to Oaxaca. A big accomplishment for Jaime is that he has been able to take over the business his father previously owned and keep it going. He aspires to make it bigger.

loans.use: to buy Oaxacan food for his business

loans.name: Las Trenceras Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank  “Las Trenceras” or “Those who Braid Hair” consists of eleven women who live in a rural area of Quiche in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The ladies are quite happy to welcome two new members to the group. They are also looking forward to securing new loans to sustain and expand their small businesses.

The President of the Trust Bank is 52-year-old Maria, who is married and has nine children. She has had six years of formal education. Maria is involved in various productive activities with the goal of generating enough income to meet her large family's daily needs, including their education needs. Maria's businesses include poultry (purchase and sale of chickens), tamales (on weekends) and products made from palm leaves. Maria is requesting a new loan which she will use to purchase additional chickens, spices for her tamale business and materials for her palm leaf creations.

The overwhelming majority of the clients of Friendship Bridge place a high priority on education, both for themselves and for their children. They are keenly aware that knowledge is a powerful tool and opens up many new opportunities. They understand that education is essential to realize a better and more prosperous life. Four of Maria’s children are in school and she works very hard to pay for all of their school expenses, including their uniforms and supplies. Her highest hope is that they graduate and find successful careers and enjoy more success than she has been able to achieve. 

The ladies in the Trust Bank meet each month with a Trust Bank officer who presents non-formal participatory educational trainings. The women are eager to learn about effective business practices, including accounting, budgeting and customer service as well as women’s rights and self esteem. They also learn about nutrition and health as well as the use of medicinal plants. It is the combination of the loans and education that comprises the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge.

The “Las Trenceras” Trust Bank extends gratitude to KIVA investors for believing in them and investing in their loans. They are committed to working hard, empowering themselves and stepping into a brighter and more prosperous future!

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens, spices for her tamale business and materials for her palm leaf creations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and a biogas stove.

loans.name: Salamiya

texts.fr: Pour améliorer les ventes, Salamiya a pris un nouveau prêt de 500000FCFA  pour acheter des pagnes, des produits alimentaires et des divers. Salamiya est une femme mariée à un enseignant. Agé de 44 ans, elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Dans l'avenir, elle espère améliorer les conditions de vie générales de  sa famille et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: To improve her sales, Salamiya has taken out a new loan of 500,000 francs CFA to purchase ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), some grocery items, and other products. Salamiya is married to a teacher. She is 44 years old and the mother of two children, both in school. For the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, 'pagne' cloth, transfers, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Kossiwa Massan Fonzan

texts.fr: Mariée à un agent de pharmacie, Kossiwa est revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des mèches et des défrisants. Mère de deux enfants respectivement âgés de 8ans et 2 ans, Kossiwa s’approvisionne dans la ville de Lomé. C’est pour la seconde fois qu’elle sollicite un microcrédit de Kiva. Ce dernier d’un montant de 150000FCFA servira à augmenter son stock de marchandise. De manière significative, Kossiwa voudrait contribuer aux besoins de ménage et projette même ouvrir une seconde boutique avec le fruit de ses efforts.
texts.en: Married to a pharmacy representative, Kossiwa has been a retailer since 2002. She sells hair extensions and straighteners. The mother of two children, aged 8 and 2 years old, Kossiwa gets her supplies from the city of Lomé. For a second time, she is requesting a Kiva micro-loan in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA for increasing her stock of merchandise. Kossiwa would like to help meet household needs to a significant degree. And she even plans to open a second shop by using the fruits of her labor.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and straighteners

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est mariée  à un employé de bureau. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante depuis 2000. Pour stocker ses marchandises, elle  demande un prêt de 600000FCFA, qu'elle utilisera pour acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et des pagnes. Agée de 48ans, Ami est maman de 4 enfants de 10, 12,15 et 18ans pour qui elle se bat pour donner une bonne éducation. Avec ce quatrième crédit, Ami  sera en mesure de répondre systématiquement à la demande croissante de ses clients. Elle envisage utiliser une partie de ses revenus pour agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Ami is married to an office worker. She has been selling goods door to door since 2000. To stock up on merchandise, she is asking for a loan of 600,000 francs that she will use to purchase kitchen utensils and some ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). 

Ami is 48 years old and the mother of four children, aged 10, 12, 15, and 18 years old. She struggles to provide them a good education. With this fourth loan, Ami will be able to respond systematically to the growing demands of her customers. She envisions using part of her revenues to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: María Petronila

texts.es:
María de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos y decidió abandonar la escuela para ayudar a sus padres. Esta acompañada y su pareja trabaja como bombero, tienen tres hijos viven en su casa y dependen de ella, además se encuentra su mamá, por lo tanto son cuatro personas las que dependen de ella.

María actualmente se dedica a vender y comprar ropa de todo estilo y tamaño, y lo ha hecho desde hace 10 años. Decidió dedicarse a este negocio debido a que antes trabajaba en la agricultura pero no obtenía mayores ingresos económicos, ella vende la ropa en los cantones aledaños a su vivienda, recorre unos 15 km diarios y lo hace de 6:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar más ropa ( blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc), ya que hay momentos en los cuales no vende por no tener una variedad.

Los sueños de María son: Poder ver crecer a sus hijos y darles el estudio que ella no tuvo para que ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad de vida y comprar un vehículo para transportarse.
texts.en:
María, 35 years old, attended school until the eighth grade because her family had scarce economic resources and she decided to leave school in order to help her parents. She has a partner and her partner works as a fireman. They have three children living at home, who are dependent on her.  As well, she has her mother and consequently four people depend on her.

María currently buys and sells clothing of all styles and sizes and has done so for 10 years. She decided to start this business because before she was working as a farmer but did not earn more income.  She sells clothing in cantons adjacent to her home.  She covers some 15 km. daily and does so from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m.

The money from the loan will be used to purchase more clothing (blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, etc) because there are moments when she does not sell because she des not have a variety.

María’s dreams are: to be able to see her children grow and give them the education she did not have so they can have a better life opportunity, and to buy a vehicle for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing (blouses, skirts, pants, underwear, etc.), since there are moments when she does not make a sale because she lacks variety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her sales by buying more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Maria Avelina

texts.en:
Maria Avelina (pictured with her husband) is 42 years old and she has been married for the last 24 years to her husband, Jesus. They have one grownup son who is independent. Maria Avelina owns a grocery store in her house, located in the Chalco neighborhood of Mexico City. She works in the store with her husband, Monday through Sunday, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.
 
Maria Avelina sells groceries, candies, sodas and other products in her store. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory. Maria Avelina says that the more products she can offer, the more she will sell. Her biggest accomplishment is building her house and helping her son to finish college and become independent.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and a biogas stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his freight truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some chairs for her snack food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase condiments, corn, cassava flour, and various other goods

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.en:
There are 8 beautiful and hard-working women in the Guatemalan community of San Pablo in the department of Quiche who are in the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Pablo.” The women share a common goal of improving their lives and moving ahead by expanding their small businesses and earning enough income to supply the basic necessities for their families.

A member of the Trust Bank, Maxi is 24 years old and has a 6-year-old daughter. Along with the other women in the Trust Bank, she is beginning her second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. Maxi has a textile business and sews beautiful blouses with detailed decoration. Her business is going well and because there is increased demand, Maxi wants to purchase a sewing machine, thread, fabric, and other necessary materials. She delivers several dozen blouses each week and also has retail sales in the nearby market.

Maxi shares that it is a real pleasure to be a part of the San Pablo Trust Bank. In the first loan cycle, she reports that she found the other ladies to be very responsible and trustworthy. She is quite excited to begin her second loan cycle. In addition, Maxi and the other the other women in the Trust Bank receive monthly training on relevant and useful subjects from a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. Some of the topics include women’s health and self-esteem, health and medicinal plants, as well as nutrition. The women are eager to learn about effective business practices, budgeting, and accounting. 

The women of the San Pablo Trust Bank are thankful that KIVA investors believe in what they are trying to achieve. They are committed to being responsible and paying back their loans fully and on time. The ladies look forward to a more prosperous future and are working hard to make that a reality!

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase canned beverages and more

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
La socia Zenobia continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia Zenobia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Zenobia continues to make a living selling food. The member has had this business for quite some time, which has done well as a result of her daily efforts. The member is a responsible and determined person, and it is in this way that the member provides for her family.

The member requests this loan to buy goods such as rice and oil, among other things.

The member Zenobia is thankful for the loan given and is committed to paying her installments within the established time period.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice and oil, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase palm nuts for producing palm oil

loans.name: Asociacion De Mujeres Group

texts.en:
The “Asociación de Mujeres” or “Association of Women” is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank in a rural area of Momostenango, Guatemala. It is made up of ten closely-knit women who form a strong allliance. There are two new members in the Trust Bank. Their small businesses include animal husbandry and traditional textile production.

Dunia is the 25 year old Secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married and has four children. She has had five years of formal education and her friends in the group have great confidence in her ability to keep track of what transpires in the monthly meetings. Dunia sells cosmetics like make-up, lip balm, creams, and perfumes to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She is requesting a new loan to increase her inventory and generate additional income.

Each month, Dunia and her fellow Trust Bank members participate in educational trainings presented by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. The ladies are eager to learn about managing their loans successfully and so topics like accounting, budgeting and customer service are very relevant and useful. Also discussed are subjects like health and nutrition, medicinal plants, and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge characterizes the combination of the loans and the education component as Microcredit Plus. It is unique to this organization in Guatemala. 

In addition, Dunia and the women are aware of the value of education for their children and this goal motivates them to succeed in their businesses. Indigenous women typically complete less than two years of schooling. Experts estimate that for every ten students who begin first grade in rural Guatemala, fewer than three will continue on to seventh grade, and only one will complete tenth grade. Family members must purchase textbooks, uniforms, and other necessary materials for their young students. 

KIVA investors are greatly valued and appreciated by the clients of Friendship Bridge. Empowered by the acquisition of new knowledge and their small loans, these women can envision a successful and more prosperous future for their small rural community in Momostenango, their families and themselves. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics inventory.

loans.name: Laniriza

texts.en:
Laniriza is twenty eight years old and has five children, four of whom are still in school. Laniriza works very hard to provide for them.

Laniriza's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Laniriza has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Laniriza is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Irene Esperanza

texts.en:
Irene Esperanza is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

She is 26 years old, lives in a commonlaw marriage and has two children. She has been in commerce for 10 years now.

At first, she helped her grandma sell sweets, toys and office supplies outside of an elementary school. Three years ago, she decided to start her own business, a Mexican antojitos stand.

She owns a food stand inside a market where she sells tortas, tacos and other typical Mexican foods. In addition, she has bathroom in the same market, which she charges customers to use. 

She asks for this loan to buy another business adjacent to hers, which is being offered to her. With the effort she puts into her work, she looks forward to giving her family economic stability and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a business space adjacent to her to expand her food stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and some fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, pans, bowls, etc.) to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice and condiments

loans.name: Ma. Beteliana

texts.en:
Ma. Beteliana is 49 old, married and has four children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Ma. Beteliana is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ma. Beteliana has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her meat vending.

With your help, Ma. Beteliana can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Donialyn

texts.en:
Donialyn is 34 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Donialyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Donialyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Donialyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business to a convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help Madelyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Madelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. With your help Adelaida will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, and is separated with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Wilma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home, and pay for construction labor.

Wilma is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 28 years old and is married with four children, three of whom are in school. Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marivic has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: La Felicidad Group

texts.en:
“La Felicidad” meaning “Happiness” is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank composed of ten hard-working women in Guatemala. Their average age is 39 years and their average number of children is five. Most of them have had an average of three years of formal education, as their priority since childhood has been to help to support their families. The women are strongly motivated to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. They are happy to be members of the Trust Bank and thus, the name “La Felicidad”.

The group is in its second loan cycle and has elected 24 year old Gloria as their Secretary. Gloria has completed her primary school education and is married with two small children. She easily carries out her role as Secretary and makes her fellow Trust Bank members feel confident in her abilities. She only speaks the language of her community which is “el kiché”.

Along with her husband, Gloria has been selling shoes for several years. She has shoe stalls in two different markets in her community. Because her business is increasing, Gloria is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase additional inventory, increase her earnings and offer her children a better future. She realizes that they are still quite young but can see a more prosperous and successful future for them with more opportunities. The couple is laying the foundation now.

Each month, the ten women of the “Felicidad” Trust Bank participate in non-formal educational trainings provided by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. The ladies are eager to learn about so many topics like self esteem and women’s rights, medicinal plants, nutrition and health. They immediately apply new knowledge about effective business practices, accounting and budgeting to their small businesses. Customer service is another relevant and useful subject for them.

Thank you, KIVA investors, for your kindness and generosity in providing funding for the small loans of these women. You are valuable partners in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge and our over 20,000 clients!

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.ru: Айжамал 47 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Айжамал - среднее образование. По характеру она очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. На протяжении 21 года она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 лошади и 20 овец, также Айжамал обрабатывает 3,00 ГА собственной земельной доли. В основном выращивает фасоль, реализуя ее оптовым покупателям. Также Айжамал на ежедневной основе реализует молоко местным жителям, совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айжамал обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Айжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Aizhamal is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Aizhamal has a secondary education. By character, she is very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. For the past 21 years, she has been raising crops and livestock. Thanks to her hard work, Aizhamal currently has on her homestead: one dairy cow, two horses and 20 sheep, and also Aizhamal works 3.00 hectares of her own land. She mainly grows beans, selling them to wholesalers. Also, Aizhamal on a daily basis sells milk to local residents, and the aggregate monthly income amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Aizhamal applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves.

Aizhamal plans to invest income from the loan in further developing the business and wants to save money for educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and married.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jocelyn is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jocelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. 

With your help, Jocelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 24 years old and has one child.  

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Cristina is taking out a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Cristina has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Cristina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 32 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school. 

Rosemarie works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jariha

texts.en:
Jariha is 48 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. 

Jariha works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for four years. She has requested a loan of PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, soap, noodles, etc.

In the future, Jariha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en: Heriberto, a Mexican cattle rancher, is looking to do more for less. He wants to reduce the operating costs on his farm while also better taking advantage of the significant cow manure produced on-site. He is investing in an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa to transform manure into renewable bio-gas and potent bio-fertilizer. The bio-gas will help him decrease his propane purchases - the fuel his family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater - and the bio-fertilizer will allow them to improve oatmeal and maize yields without spending more on petroleum-based fertilizers. This loan represents 50% of Heriberto's bio-digester and bio-gas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa bio-digester and bio-gas stove to transform manure into renewable bio-gas and bio-fertilizer.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Tiessiri vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bougoufié l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le commerce de calebasse, d’ustensile et de produit cosmétique. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 11eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Lalla debout au milieu  est une grande vendeuse de calebasses dans le quartier de Bougoufié et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 calebasses à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Lalla espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille  et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Tiessiri all live in traditional families and average 44 years of age and three children each. All the women live in the Bougoufié district, one of the districts in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They do commerce in calabashes, utensils, and cosmetics products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eleventh solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Lalla, who is standing in the middle, is a major vendor of calabashes in and around the Bougoufié district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 calabashes in Ségou. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit at her house and at the market.

With this loan, Ms. Lalla hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used in part to support the family and also to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase calabashes

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Gantuya is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She and her husband have been making and selling clothes to local people since 2010. They purchase raw materials such as textiles and buttons from markets at wholesale prices and later makes clothes at their small workshop. 

Gantuya is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car for transportation. The electric car emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. Using this environmental friendly car for transporting clothes to distribution points will help her business greatly, saving time and energy.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebougou l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font la restauration et le petit commerce d’habillement et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Coumba (la deuxième assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le quartier de Sebougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de mil à Ségou dans le but d’en faire de galettes  à  sauce a base de poisson. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Coumba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Danaya all live in nuclear families and average 33 years of age and three children each. All the women live in the Sebougou district, one of the districts in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They work in food service and do commerce in clothing and condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Coumba (sitting second from the right in the photo) is a major restauranteur in and around the Sebougou district. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 sacks of millet in Ségou to make galettes served with a sauce made with fish. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit at her house and at the market.

With this loan, Ms. Coumba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for her children’s schooling costs and also for increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make galettes

loans.name: Genilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Genilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport services. Genilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of fish to sell in her business.

Genilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Merlinda's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her rice retailing business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Merlinda is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Merlinda has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is 40 years old and married with nine children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Isabel's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Isabel has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Isabel is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 28 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She has an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business activities. She has now requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Cabigona

texts.en:
Cabigona is 43 years old, and is widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years, and also earns an income from selling food. Cabigona has requested a loan of PHP 13,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. Prior to this loan, she has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF. 

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 49-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Sally has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Sally has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Sally would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is married and she works hard to support her family.

She sells sea-shells in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nory is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of sea-shells to sell.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sea-shells to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is married and has on child. 

She sells fish for a living, and many people come to buy from her every day. She has been involved in this business since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Amelia is borrowing $600 to improve her business. She will buy more fish to sell. 

Running a business has made Amelia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old and is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy more stock for her store. This includes noodles, fish, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Veronica is living in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fish, eggs, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread.

loans.name: Julmira

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to improve Julmira's business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own effort. She will use the loan to buy stock, including beer, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, Fanta, oils, eggs, bread and water. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of work. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, Fanta, oils, eggs, bread and water.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Francisca to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy from her every day. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, shampoo, soap, oils, sugar, salt and slippers.

Francisca has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Francisca independent because she can be responsible for herself and also for helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, shampoo, soap, oils, sugar, salt and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ailyn. She is married and has three children. In 2004, Ailyn established her direct selling business (selling mainly cosmetic products). She began her business to enhance her regular income for her livelihood. Her business is located in their village and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns a good income from this business. 

Ailyn would like a loan from GDMPC. She requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetic products to sell. She hopes that this loan will help improve her status, both at home and in her business. 

In the future, Ailyn plans to start buying more stock from the company, rather than taking supplies from local wholesalers at higher costs.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 29 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Manilyn has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and is a married mother of four children. Three of her children are in school. 

Helen is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more wood for her furniture business.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood for her furniture business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. 

She runs a furniture business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy wood for making tables and chairs, and for repairing the machinery. Judith opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of $500. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood for making tables and chairs, and for repairing the machinery.

loans.name: Ma. Jean

texts.en:
Ma. Jean is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Jean is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Ma. Jean requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Jean has been farming bananas for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $100. A $600 (USD) loan is offered to Dulce to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock such as beer, oils, noodles, bread and soap to keep in her store. 

Dulce is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy beer, oils, noodles, bread and soap

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Missira l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mah (la 1ere femme debout de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 pièces de pagne wax à Bamako et Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché  et en ambulant dans la ville  à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women in the Danaya group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 34 years old with two children, and all live in the Missira neighborhood of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through neighborhood ties, kinship, marriage and their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are retail merchants of clothing, food and condiments. In order to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan cycle.

Ms. Mah (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is a great vendor of pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric), in the neighborhood and its surrounding area. She intends to use her loan to buy eight lengths of pagne wax fabric in Bamako and Ségou.

Sales are conducted to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit,  from her home, in the market and as an itinerant vendor throughout the city.

Ms. Mah hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her children's small needs, and also to increase her stock supply.

loans.use: buy pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is from Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 36 years old, is married and has five children. Three of them are school aged. In order to have her own source of income, five years ago she opened a small business in the village delivering distilled water. She also sells cosmetics via catalog. She is asking for her first loan to increase her inventory and buy merchandise in the city in order to offer her products at accessible prices in her village. She plans to buy additional distilled water, cosmetic products and eggs to resell. Her dream is to sell dairy products and ground meat and for her business to be prosperous.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy merchandise like distilled water, cosmetic products and eggs to resell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a friendly and happy man who comes from Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is 58 years old and is married, with three children. He has seven years of experience as a baker and he sells bread and pastries for a living. He lives in a stilt house made out of wood with only one room, an overcrowded space for his family. 

With the intent of improving his home and allowing his family to live more safely and respectably, he is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials to prepare snacks to sell in order to gain more revenue. His dream is to have a safe home with basic conditions for his children's comfort.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to prepare snacks to sell

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbaatar, 46 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as welder at a power plant since 2004. His wife is unemployed and stays at home. Their children both go to high school. 

Sukhbaatar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to open a cafeteria. He is planning to rent a small, old house near his home in order to use it as a cafeteria. His wife will be employed; she will be the main person responsible for running the cafeteria, as he is busy. This business will, if it succeeds, greatly increase their living standard.

loans.use: to open a cafeteria

loans.name: Kpedetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupement KPEDETIN est composé de dix neuf personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Afiavi Sylvie Agnès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Afiavi Sylvie Agnès est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Gervais. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de leurs enfants. Afiavi Sylvie Agnès vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Afiavi Sylvie Agnès assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Afiavi Sylvie Agnès mène comme activité depuis six ans, la vente de produits congelés à son domicile. Afiavi Sylvie Agnès exerce cette activité depuis six ans. Afiavi Sylvie Agnès s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Afiavi Sylvie Agnès sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe KPEDETIN, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de leurs produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.  Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Kpedetin group consists of nineteen people who are friends living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Afiavi Sylvie Agnes, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Afiavi Sylvie Agnes is 44 years old and is married to Gervais. The couple has three children, all in school, and who are their dependents. The couple has another child under their care, in addition to their own children. Afiavi Agnes Sylvie lives with her children and her husband, and manages together with her ​​husband the various household needs.

To achieve this, Afiavi Sylvie Agnès has been running a business selling frozen products from her home. She has been performing this activity for the past six years, and resupplies in one of Benin's cities.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Afiavi Sylvie Agnes is requesting, together with other members of the Kpedetin group, a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to bolster the stock of their products and increase their customer base. The first loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: buy frozen prodects

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 41-year-old married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen has an upholstery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. 

Helen has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Cristina works hard to support her family. She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice. Ma. Cristina is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads and zippers for her sewing business.

Ma. Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads and zippers for her business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Carmen is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of spices to sell in her stall.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Mnera

texts.ru: Мнера, 42 года, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У Мнеры - средне-специальное медицинское образование, работает фельдшером, с 2007 года она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мнеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 10 овец и 17 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мнера обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. После закупки коров, они будут находиться в собственном хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Мнера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения детей и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Mnera is 42 years old, not married and a mother of 2 children. Mnera has a secondary-specialized, medical education and works as an orderly. She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2007. Thanks to Mnera's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 2 calves, 10 sheep and 17 goats. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mnera requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. After the purchase, the cows will stay on her farm. Mnera plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and saving money to educate her children, and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is 54 years old and living with her family members in a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 15 years. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day for her future needs. 

Yen has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to raise more crops to sell for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Gulzhan

texts.ru: Гулжан 54 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. У Гулжан - среднее образование, занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1984 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 7 лошадей и 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока, молочной продукции и мяса составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку нового дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulzhan is 54 years old, a widow and a mother of 5 children. Gulzhan has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 1984. Thanks to Gulzhan's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 7 horses and 6 sheep. The monthly income from selling milk, dairy products and meat amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Gulzhan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow and sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Gulzhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is asking for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married, and she has two children  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as bread, books, pencils, water, shampoo, soap, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and slippers.

Maria opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy bread, books, pencils, water, shampoo, soap, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee and slippers

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married.  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as oils, bread, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy oils, bread, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and cigarettes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margarita is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Margarita has a buy and sell of ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Margarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Srey is 41 years old and married with six children. She has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland for 20 years. She can earn about KHR 40,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for her future needs. 

Srey has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the prior loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Srey wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to raise more crops to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Aina

texts.ru: Айна, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей, все они взрослые и самостоятельные. По хозяйству Айне помогает супруг. У Айны - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Стартовав в 1984 году, благодаря упорному труду Айны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 7 дойных коров, 15 овец, 2 лошади и 7 коз. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айна планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Aina is 54 years old, married and raising 5 children together with her husband. Aina's husband helps her with the business. Aina has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry. Started in 1984, today her business contains 7 dairy cows, 15 sheep, 2 horses and 7 goats, thanks to Aina's hard work. The monthly income from selling livestock amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Aina requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy horses in order to increase livestock headcount. Aina plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities and saving money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy horses

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling religious articles in the Philippines. 

She is asking for a loan of 12,500 Philippine Pesos through NWTF to buy more stocks of religious articles to sell in her business.

Virgilia has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from candle vending.

Virgilia has been building her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of religious articles to sell

loans.name: Koern's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Koern is aged 33 years old, and married. She has three children to take care of, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for several years. Her current business earns her about 48,000 Cambodia Riels per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Koern’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Her past loans have helped her gradually improve her living standard. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice at the right time, so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer and spare parts for her business.

Wilma has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from gravestone making.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Navy is aged 38 years and married. She has five children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice for 10 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.

Navy has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she successfully paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy corn and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Sognigbé Ayélé Mathilde

texts.fr: Ayélé, 42 ans , a commencé son activité en 2011  .Mariée à un journaliste, elle n’a pas encore la chance d’être appelé maman. Elle vend des poissons séchés à domicile. Elle procède aussi par la distribution de sa marchandise aux bonnes dames du marché. Elle a souvent du mal à servir toute la demande dû à son manque de stock. Aujourd’hui à son quatrième prêt, Ayélé travaille  durement  pour augmenter sa capacité d’approvisionnement.
texts.en:
Ayélé, 42 years old, started her business in 2011. Married to a journalist, she has not yet had the opportunity to be called mom.

She sells dried fish at home. She also distributes her wares to lady vendors at the market. It is often hard to fully respond to the demand due to lack of stock.

Now on her fourth loan, Ayélé is working hard to increase her supply capacity.

loans.use: buy dried fish

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, farmer of 10 years, works on a farm with her husband who operates a tractor for a living. She dreams of leaving the love of farming to her children. Marlyn is proud to be a part of the production, and the harvesting of rice for sale. This is the motor that drives her eagerness to produce with quality and be a proud example for her children.

When their farm is prepared for production, her husband shares the machine tractor in their village.Their small farm comes with a benefit, with which Marlyn has improved her crop harvest and her income. With the goal of continuous improvement, she has decided to invest for a greener farm. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that help her to achieve her goal of having her own machinery.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nelba

texts.en:
Nelba is 41 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Nelba works very hard to provide for them.
