Nelba runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell.Nelba has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, noodles, etc.Nelba would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kim is a 36-year-old married mother of three children. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 12 years. Together, they can earn about 48,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and they  manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Kim has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ellen requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for four years.In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Anie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes. Anie is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. Patricia's husband knows all about rice cultivation and is an enormous support for her. She has always repaid her loans at Seva MFI on time. With a loan from MFI Seva, Patricia can sow on time. With the rice cultivation she sustains her family and pays for the education of her children. Patricia also wants to buy a piece of land and save for the future of her and her family. She asks Seva MFI for another loan of SRD 7,000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Nelly is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetable to sell through her vegetable vending business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 30 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Phnom Proek district of the Battambang province. She has four dependent children to take care of. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income for them to make a living, and she has been in this business for nine years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 69,000KHR per day and save about 40,000KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the fourth micro loan for Touch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, Touch wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan will help Maria to improve her business. Maria opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like shampoo, bread, cigarettes, milk and oil. Maria is generating a good income from selling such items.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of doing business.  Maria is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store like shampoo, bread, cigarettes and milk.

loans.name: Las Exitosas De San Martin Group

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del grupo “Las exitosas de San Martín”. Ella tiene 3 hijos. En su casa viven ella, su conjugue (con quien no esta casada), sus 3 hijos y su suegra. Los gastos del hogar son compartidos entre ella y su conjugue. La señora se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto de desayuno, almuerzo y cena ya que trabaja diez horas diarias. Lleva ya dos años en el negocio y atiende a un gran número de personas diariamente que va a su puesto de comida principalmente por su buena sazón. La señora refiere que se siente orgullosa de lo que hace, puesto que con su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Antes de iniciar su negocio era cosmetóloga sin embargo tuvo que dejar de trabajar en ese rubro cuando su esposo se accidento y no contaba con el tiempo necesario para dedicarse del todo a ese rubro. La Sra. Nancy vio que la venta de comida era más rentable  Se vio obligada a usar su talento en la cocina para iniciar su negocio que hasta ahora le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, siendo una de estas darles a sus hijos una buena alimentación y educación.
La señora se siente entusiasmada con el crédito que se le dio EDAPROSPO ya que con este, la señora Nancy podrá comprar más insumos para preparar la comida para su negocio debido a la alta demanda de sus platos. El sueño de la señora es seguir progresando y algún día llegar a tener un restaurante moderno y grande. 
La señora tiene apenas un año en el grupo y cuenta que todo ha caminado muy bien desde que entró a este. Se lleva muy bien con las otras socias y no ha tenido problema alguno con alguna de ellas. Al saber que inversionistas de todo el mundo como Kiva la apoyan ella comento que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo y espera que sigan confiando en ella y en otras personas que necesitan de un crédito para seguir manteniendo sus negocios a flote.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the group “Las exitosas de San Martín”. She has 3 children. Aside from her, her partner (to whom she is not married), her 3 children and her mother-in-law all live in her home. She shares the household expenses with her partner. She dedicates herself to selling food for breakfast, lunch and dinner and works 10 hours a day. She has been in this business for two years and serves a great number of people daily who come to her stall mainly because of the great flavour of the food. Nancy mentions that she is proud of what she does as with her work she has been able to support her family. Before she began her business she was a beautician, however she had to stop that line of work when her husband had an accident and she no longer had enough time for it. Mrs. Nancy saw that the sale of food was more profitable. She was forced to use her talents in the kitchen to start her business which has to date given her many satisfactions, including being able to give her children good nutrition and education.
Nancy feels excited about her loan from EDAPROSPO and with it she will be able to buy more ingredients to make the food for her business as she is experiencing high demand. Her dream is to keep progressing and to some day have a large modern restaurant.

Nancy has only been with the group for one year and tells us that everything has been going very well since she found the group. She gets along very well with the other members and hasn't had any problems with any of them. When she found out that lenders from around the world like Kiva are supporting her, she commented that she feels very grateful for the support and hopes people keep trusting her and other people who need loans to keep their businesses afloat.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to make the food for her business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 46 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Merlyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling corn.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Succet

texts.en:
Succet is 38 years old and married with one child in school. Succet works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Succet has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Succet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 42 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genalyn has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Genalyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sarorm's Group

texts.en:
Sarorm, 31, is married with one child and residing in a rural village in the Phnom Proek district of the Battambang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for seven years while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR75,000 per day and can save about KHR30,000 each day for future needs. 

Sarorm has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertiliser and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty is 59 years old and lives with her husband and nine children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming is the only main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland for about 37 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 80,000KHR, but she is able to save 40,000KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Ty with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertiliser and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Nem, aged 35, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district and has two children. She and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 15 years. The current business earns her about 36,000KHR per day.  
This is a micro loan for Nem with VisionFund, and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. 
Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertiliser and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia Emiliana continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member Emiliana continues to work on her business selling staple goods. She has been running this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can support her family. 
The member is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, and other things for her business.
She feels grateful for the loan offered to her and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other things for her business.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia Maria continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de abarrotes ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual leva bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el  préstamo para comprar leche, arroz entre otros para su negocio.
La socia Maria se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member María is continuing to run her business selling groceries. She has been running this business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in to it everyday. She is a responsible and earnest person and is supporting her family this way.
She is requesting the loan to buy milk, rice, and other goods for her business.
The member María is grateful for the loan awarded to her and she promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and other things for her business.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Veneranda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Veneranda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.for her general store business.

Veneranda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 43-years-old and married with six children, three of whom are in school, Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Daisy has been in this business for three years .

In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 55 años estudio hasta 9° grado está casado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, un hijo es el que vive con ellos.

Francisco actualmente trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, lo aprendió de sus tíos, además de la agricultura él compra y vende ganado y le ayuda su hijo, se traslada 2 km en bicicleta para llegar a su parcela, horario de trabajo no tiene, porque hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado regresa a su casa.

El dinero del préstamo será invertido para sembrar maíz, él ya cuenta con un capital, por lo que el préstamo le servirá para completar los gastos que tiene ya programados.


Los sueños de Francisco son: Poder seguir trabajando para darles el sustento a su familia, tener suficiente ganado para obtener mayores ingresos económicos, sabe que es un reto pero con la ayuda de Dios y su esfuerzo lo hará realidad.
texts.en:
Francisco, 55 years old, went to school up to the 9th grade.  He is married and his partner takes care of the household chores. One son lives with them.

At the moment Francisco works in agriculture, and he has done so since he was a child. He learned how from his uncles and in addition to agriculture, he buys and sells cattle, helped by his son. He travels 2km by bicycle to arrive at his plot, and he doesn't have a fixed work schedule because he works until he finished doing everything he had planned before returning to his house.

The money from the loan will be invested to sow corn. He already has some capital, the money from the loan will help him finish paying the costs that he already has planned. 

Francisco's dreams are: to be able to continue working to give sustenance to his family, and to have enough cattle to increase his earnings. He knows that this is a challenge but with the help of God and his efforts, it can come true.

loans.use: to plant corn; he already has some capital, this loan will serve to help him finish paying the costs that he already has planned.

loans.name: Bertha Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Bertha continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de de perfumes y colonias para su negocio.
La socia Bertha se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner Bertha continues to work in her business of selling beauty products. She has worked in this business for some time and it is going well, thanks to the determination that she brings every day to her work. She is a responsible and determined person because this is how she supports her family. 

She asks for this loan to buy perfumes and colognes for her business.

Bertha feels grateful for the offered loan and is committed to make the payments on the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and colognes for her business.

loans.name: Godofredo Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos continua dedicándose a trabajar en una entidad del estado en el área administrativa ,el socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar algunas mejoras en su casa.
El socio agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales y con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member Carlos continues to work for a State entity focused on administration. He has been doing this work for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. The member is a responsible and diligent person and this is how he is raising his family.
He is requesting the loan in order to make some repairs to his house.
He is grateful to the lenders for the support offered to him and he promises to make his repayments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his house.

loans.name: Lilian Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Lilian es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable ella  vive con sus cuatro hijos en el Barrio el Centro, Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Desde hace mas de 25 años. 
Sus ingresos provienen de su actividad comercial (Venta de Golosinas y pulperia) desde hace mas de 1 año Doña Lilian tiene más de 25 años de ser comerciante en la comunidad de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, por lo cual es muy conocida y respetada por las personas de la comunidad que le conocen, en el momento de la visita se verificó que cuenta con muy buena cantidad de clientes ya que ella es una persona que se preocupa por la presentación de su negocio ya que es muy ordenada e impecable en el orden de su negocio.  
Ella está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar más productos para su negocio como churros, confites, galletas, azúcar, sal, carnes, lácteos, granos básicos y otros productos de uso básico ya que su clientela es mucha y quiere mantener una variada cantidad de productos, además la feria patronal de la comunidad está por comenzar lo cual se espera que le genere muy buenas ventas durante estos próximos días.  
Ella espera con este préstamo poder comprar variedad de productos para satisfacer las múltiples necesidades de sus clientes y que esto venga a mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 
Ella espera que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos para en un futuro poder abastecer a muchas más personas, ya que su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan recibir una buena educación y ser una personas honestas y trabajadoras.  
Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – Abril-2014
texts.en:
Lilian is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with her 4 children in the neighborhood of El Centro, Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. She has lived there for more than 25 years. Her income comes from her business selling candy and groceries and she has been doing this for more than a year. Lilian has had businesses in the community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa for more than 25 years so she is very well known and respected by the people that she knows in the community. At the time of our visit, she told us that she has a very good base of customers as she is someone who worries about how her business is presented so it is very well ordered and impeccable.  
She is requesting a loan to buy more products for her business such as churros, candy, cookies, sugar, salt, meat, dairy products, staple grains, and other everyday items as she has many customers and she wants to keep a variety and good quantity of products. Also, the local country fair is about to start so she hopes to have very good sales over the coming days. 
She hopes that, with this loan, she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the many needs of her customers and that this will improve her income. 
She hopes that her business will keep growing and she can keep working with loans in the future so that she can supply more people. Her dream is to help her children to get a good education do that they can be honest and hardworking people. 
Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras - April 2014.

loans.use: To buy churros, candy, cookies, sugar, salt, meat, dairy products, grains and other staple goods for her business.

loans.name: Glenda Marisela

texts.es:
Doña Glenda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la comunidad de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Desde hace mas de 5 años. Su actividad laboral es la venta y reparación de celulares, accesorios de celulares, y además tiene venta de lociones de lo cual ella cuenta con un 30% de descuento. En el barrio el Capiro, de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, dándoles atención a todas las personas de la comunidad y lugares cercanos, sus trabajos son muy solicitados ya que ella maneja precios accesibles en los trabajos de reparación y realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad.
Glenda lleva ya 5 años desempeñándose en esta actividad comercial. Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas productos como ser Teléfonos, cargadores de pared y de carro, manos libres, cargadores universales y otros, ella quiere tener mucha más variedad de productos que ofrecerle a sus clientes para así atraer a nuevos clientes a su negocio, Ella espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a él contara con los productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar. Ella espera que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia. Y así poder tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - Abril - 2014
texts.en:
Glenda is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives with her husband and their 2 children in the community of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. For the past 5 years, her work has been the sale and repair of cell phones, cell phone accessories, and also she has lotions for sale, for which she has a 30% discount. In the neighborhood of Capiro, in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, given all the people in the community and nearby places, her services are much in demand since she offers reasonable prices for the repair work and does very high quality work. 

Glenda has been carrying out this business for 5 years. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of products such as phones, chargers for the wall and car, hand-free phones, universal chargers, and other things for her business. Glenda wants to have much more variety of products to offer her customers, and to attract new customers to her business.  She hopes that the loan will help her a lot because, thanks to it, she will have the necessary products to meet the needs of her customers. In this way, she will earn more income and improve the quality of life of her family at home. She hopes that her business continues growing and in this way to support her family, and so provide have better opportunities in the future.  

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - April - 2014

loans.use: to buy phones, chargers for the wall and car, hand-free phones, universal chargers, and other things for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new bicycle and pay for school tuition for her daughter .

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang, 51, lives with her husband and four children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about 44,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Kheang has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for one cycle. She is now applying for a loan. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun is 58 years old, living with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district. Rice farming is the only source for her family’s income for about 38 years. The current business earns her family 44,000 KHR per day, of which she is able to save 19,000 KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Hun with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 57 years old and widowed with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Amelita is borrowing PHP 18,500 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Amelita has been raising livestock for 50 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
María de 56 años de edad estudio hasta 2° grado debido a  la pobreza que vivían sus padres, y la poca importancia que tenían del estudio, es viuda su esposo murió hace 20 años y no quiso volver a casarse tiene dos hijos,  pero ya están aparte con ella viven solo dos nietos.  


María se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 14 años, oficio que aprendió de su papá cuando se caso siguió en el mismo trabajo. Actualmente es líder de un grupo de mujeres que trabajan en las hortalizas,  han realizado una cooperativa de mujeres han solicitado un crédito para elaboración de una casa maya,  donde tienen una siembra de chile.  Ella comienza su día a  las 5:00 AM a preparar sus nietos,  se traslada para su trabajo lo hace en una mototaxi para conducirse a su cultivo trabajan 6 horas diarias.   

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de abono,  pesticidas, semilla , Foliar para la siembra de 7000 metros cuadrados. 

María  sueña en poder tener un mercado de negocios con el grupo de mujeres con el que esta trabajando, y tener un negocio propio para darle empleo a jóvenes.
texts.en:
María, 56 years old, went to school to the 2nd grade due to her parents' poverty and the little they valued education. She is a widow; her husband died 20 years ago and she didn't want to remarry. She has two children, but they live separately, only 2 grandchildren live with her. 

María has worked in agriculture since she was 14 years old, a trade she learned from her father and when she married, she continued with the same work. At the moment she is the leader of a women's group that works with vegetables. They have made a women's cooperative and have requested the loan to build a Mayan house where they have planted chili peppers. She begins her day at 5:00 AM to get her grandchildren ready, she goes by motorbike taxi to her field and works 6 hours every day.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and plant fertilizers absorbed through the leaves to plant 7000 square meters.

María dreams of being able to have a business market with the women's group with which she is working, and to have her own business to provide jobs for young people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, and plant fertilizers absorbed through the leaves to plant 7000 square meters

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She works hard to support her family.  She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.  Mercedita has been in this business for 15 years now.  She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable ella vive con su esposo y un hijo en el Barrio Las Crucitas de Santa Cruz de Yojoa,  Cortes. Desde hace más de 37 años. Ella es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos y conocidos.  
Su negocio es una Venta de Comida  la cual realiza en una Escuela Privada de su comunidad, en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, desde hace mas de 5 años, brindándole atención a todos los niños y maestros de la escuela. Doña Marina con mucho esfuerzo de su parte y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor a logrado establecer una Mini Pulpería en su casa de habitación brindándoles atención a sus vecinos y personas cercanas a su Barrio. 
Ella está pidiendo el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frescos, harina, maseca, jabón, leche, etc. Ya que ella quiere contar con más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.  
Ella  espera que con este préstamo su negocio pueda abastecer a muchas más personas de su Barrio y lugares cercanos a él  y de esta manera le generara más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Ella espera que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y seguir trabajando con este tipo de créditos para en un futuro poder abastecer a muchas más personas, ya que su sueño es poder llegar a tener una pulpería fuerte en un futuro. 

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – ABRIL-2014
texts.en:
Marina is a very hard-working and responsible person. She lives with her husband and a child in the Las Crucitas neighborhood of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortés. She has lived there for more than 37 years. She is well-known and respected by her neighbors and acquaintances.

Her business is food sales, which she has done in a private school in her community, in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, for more than 5 years, serving all the children and teachers in the school. Marina, with much effort on her part and with the help of her older son, managed to set up a convenience store in her home serving her neighbors and people who live near her neighborhood.  

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in her business, in the purchase of rice, sugar, soft drinks, flour, instant corn masa mix, soap, milk, etc. since she wants to have more variety of products to offer her customers.

She hopes that with this loan her business will be able to supply many more people in her neighborhood and nearby locations and in this way she will create more income to improve her family's quality of life.

She hopes that her business will continue growing and to continue working with this type of loan in the future to be able to serve many more people, since it is her dream to have a substantial convenience store in the future. 

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – April-2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, flour, instant corn masa mix, soap, milk, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
La socia Jacinta continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de golosinas, tortas, gaseosas, pasteles, galletas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio de kiosco escolar, la socia  es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jacinta continues to work at her business selling candies, cakes, soft drinks, pastries, cookies, and other things. She has worked in this business for some time which has gone well thanks to the dedications she brings every day to her business of a school food stand. She is a responsible person and wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She asks for this loan to buy soft drinks among other things.

She is grateful for the loan offered and promises to meet the established payments.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks among other things.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
La señora Alba se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería( pulpería) esto lo realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 1 años, su negocio se encuentra en la calle principal de su colonia y es muy visitada por los clientes ya que es la única en la zona, ella solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de productos como ser; arroz, manteca, azúcar, huevos, refresco, condimentos, pan, café y otros productos de la canasta familiar, para la buena atención de sus clientes, ella sueña con tener un negocio bien abastecido con todo lo necesario para  la buena atención a sus clientes, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y cambiar de manera positiva  su condición de vida.

Danlí, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Alba works in a shop. Her main business is selling groceries (in a local store). She has worked from the house where she lives for more than a year. Her business is on the main street of her town and is well-frequented by customers as it is the only one in the area.

She is asking for the support of a loan to buy products such as rice, butter, sugar, eggs, soft drinks, condiments, bread, coffee and other products for the family shopping basket, so that she can take good care of her customers. 

She dreams of having a well-stocked business with every necessity in order to take care of her customers, and in this way increase her profits and change her living conditions in a positive way.

Danlí, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, butter, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 40-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, The operator of a general store in the Philippines for the past six years, she works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero vive con su madre, aprendió el oficio de mecánico siendo un adolescente, su taller tiene 20 años de estar funcionando, eventualmente contrata personal cuando las demandas de sus servicios aumentan, por su experiencia el negocio se ha mantenido y no representa dificultades.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de lubricantes, juego de llaves, pastillas para frenos, cables, espejos, adictivos, etc., le ayudara a tener herramientas que le faciliten realizar otras reparaciones que sus clientes solicitan pero que no tenía el equipo necesario para realizarlas.
Juan aspira a fortalecer su negocio más, con lo que aumentara la rentabilidad y cancelara sus deudas sin alguna dificultad así como también aportara su ayuda económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is single and lives with his mother. He learned the trade of mechanic when he was a teenager, and his workshop has been functioning for 20 years. He sometimes hires workers when the demand for his services increase. For his experience, the business has been maintained and doesn't have any problems. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of lubricants, a set of wrenches, brake pads, cables, mirrors, additives, etc. It will help him to have tools that will allow him to make other repairs that his customers request but that he doesn't have the necessary equipment to do.

Juan aspires to strengthen his business more, which will increase its profitability and pay off his debts without any difficulty, so he could also bring more economic help to his home.

loans.use: to buy lubricants, a set of wrenches, brake pads, cables, mirrors, additives, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, ha  tenido una cosecha abundante, sin plagas, las ventas mejoraran junto con sus ingresos, estos efecto positivos han sido el resultado de la inversión del crédito anterior. Su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida y ha cancelado su deuda.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito ya que dice que es una forma de ir progresando poco a poco  comprara abono, semilla, pesticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas y gasolina para la achicadora, de esta manera se mantendrá trabajando.
texts.en:
Luis has had an abundant harvest without any infestations. The sales have improved along with his income; these positive effects have been the result of the investment of his previous loan. His family has a better way of life and he has paid off his debt.

He decided on a new loan because he says that it is a way to progress bit by bit. He will buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and gasoline for the generator, and in this way he will continue working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides and gasoline

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Phen, 32, is a married mother of three residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice as the main source of income. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Phen has been with VisionFund for nine cycles and has repaid all past loans. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. As the leader, she will  use her portion to buy fertilizers and pay labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and labor fees

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is a 35-year-old-married mother of three school-aged children. For many years, Vannak has been engaged in agricultural and vending businesses, primarily farming rice and selling general products and hog feed. Her husband helps share their living costs by making white wine and raising pigs. Through their hardships, they aim to provide educational opportunities to their children and give them a better quality of life.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program which offers a special rate, Vannak is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she is requesting to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Janer Esneider

texts.es:
Janer es un hombre joven y emprendedor, se desempeña como vendedor y distribuidor de pipetas de gas residencial en Valencia, Córdoba.
Trabaja todos los días y su esposa le ayuda en esta labor, aunque no tiene hijos, desea tener estabilidad económica para el sustento propio y el de su esposa, de igual forma ayuda económicamente a su madre.
El solicita un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y asegurar su continuidad en el mercado comprando más pipetas de gas.
Esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y directamente sus utilidades.
Su principal objetivo es tener un local donde pueda vender su producto y un carro en al cual pueda transportarlo.
texts.en:
Janer is an enterprising young man and he works as a seller and distributor of domestic gas cylinders in Valencia, Córdoba.

He works every day and his wife helps him in this work. Although they don't have children, he wants to have economic stability for his own and his wife's sustenance, as well as be an economic support for his mother.

He asks for economic support to gain more capital for his business and assure its continuity in the market by buying more gas cylinders.

This will allow him to increase his sales and also his profits.

His primary objective is to have a place where he can sell his product and a car with which he can transport it.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.name: Roque Jacinto

texts.es: Roque tiene 56 años de edad y trabaja como empleado en un taller de enderezado y pintura. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 13 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Roque desea terminar de construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir. Además, desea hacer un corredor en la vivienda y hacer un relleno en el suelo. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, etc.
texts.en: Roque is 56 years old and works as an employee in a bodywork and painting shop. He is a very hardworking man and is dedicated to his family. He lives in his own house with his wife and their young daughter, 13 years old, who currently is studying at the public school in their area.  Roque wants to finish building a fourth bedroom in his house that, with much effort, he has managed to build. In addition, he wands to build a hallway in his house and backfill the floor. For this, he has asked for this loan from FUSIA to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, etc.

loans.use: to buy: galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, etc., to build the roof of a room and to build a hallway in his house.

loans.name: San Juaquin Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socios laboriosos y coordinado por el señor Santiago de 40 años, casado y padre de dos hijos y solamente uno depende de él, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa usada en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para aumentar la mercadería y comprar pacas de calidad de camisas, shorts, pantalón y vestidos, con los créditos ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida, pues los créditos han hecho posible aumentar el negocio y con ellos las ganancias. Los otros socios son la señora Tania de 30 años quien ofrece nacatamales, tortillas y enchiladas en su domicilio y la señora Damaris de 23 años de edad la cual brinda el servicio de hecha y venta de tortillas y enchiladas en su domicilio. Este grupo tiene 19 ciclos prestando en esta institución y han demostrado ser socios solidarios.
texts.en: The solidarity group is made up of three hardworking members and is coordinated by Santiago, who is 40 years old, married, and the father of two children, one of whom is dependent on him. He works in selling used clothing from his home. He requests a loan to increase his merchandise and to buy quality packages of shirts, shorts, pants, and dresses. With the loans, he has managed to improve his quality of life, since the loans have made it possible to expand his business, and also his income.  The other members are Tania, 30 years old, who sells Nicaraguan tamales, tortillas and enchiladas in her home, and Damaris, 23 years old, who offers the service of making and selling tortillas and enchiladas in her home. The group has 19 loan cycles with this institution and has shown themselves to be supportive members.

loans.use: to buy packages of quality used clothing

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto de 63 años de edad, por motivos de distancia solo estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica y después decidió dedicarse al  trabajo de la agricultura, él es acompañado tiene 4 hijos junto a su esposa, ella se dedica a  los oficios domésticos de la casa y al cuido de animales domésticos, (gallinas) 2 hijos están acompañados y 2 están en la escuela y son los que dependen de él.

Edilberto tiene 50 años de experiencia de dedicarse a este trabajo,  ya que desde que estaba muy pequeño decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando,  el aprendió este trabajo ya que su padre se lo enseño desde que estaba  muy pequeño;  él viaja a pie 30 minutos para llegar hasta el lugar donde trabaja, y sus 2 hijos le ayudan debido a que ellos estudian por la tarde y tiene la oportunidad de ayudarle a trabaja en la mañana.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 6 sacos de fertilizante, 2 bolsas de semilla y pago de mano de obra.   

Él desea a futuro con el crédito poder tener y darle un buen mantenimiento a su milpa, así tener mejores rendimientos, y tener alimentación para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto, 63 years old, because of the distance only went to school until the second grade of primary school, and afterwards decided to work in agriculture. He has a partner and with her has 4 children. She takes care of the household tasks and the care of the domestic animals (chickens). Two of the children have partners, and 2 are in school and are dependent on him.

Edilberto has 50 years of experience in this work, because since he was very young he decided to do this work, as he didn't have the opportunity to continue at school.  He learned this work because his father taught it to him since he was very young.  He goes by foot 30 minutes to get to the place where he works, and 2 of his children help him since they go to school in the afternoon and have the opportunity to help him in the morning.

The loan he is requesting is to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, 2 bags of seeds, and pay labor costs.

He hopes that with his loan he will be able to have and maintain his cornfield well, so he can have better output and have food for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of fertilizer, 2 bags of seeds, and pay labor costs

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores - Poroy Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES DE POROY, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Alicia tiene 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,leche,azucar ,golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz para su negocio.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por m motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ver5duras, venta de fruta, venta de comida, venta de huevos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES DE POROY" communal bank which is located in the Department of Cusco.

Alicia is 35 years old, married and has 4 children.She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells different types of products like rice, milk, sugar, candies etc. She has been doing this for years and things are going well that to the effort she puts in every day into her business. At the same time she also raises small animals like guinea pigs. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to be able to continue working in this manner so she can continue to support her family. Alicia is requesting a loan to buy rice for her business.

The member who appears in the attached photo asked permission to arrive to the meeting late due to work commitments.The other members sell vegetables, sell fruit, sell food and sell eggs. Alicia is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice for her business.

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora Silvia de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, su negocio es la venta de ropa y comida en su domicilio, por lo que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisetas, blusas, jean Lee, jean kalua, jeans big time, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda y la ha ayudado en su superación personal por lo que le ha permitido brindarle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Las otras socias son las señoras Eloisa de 32 años dedicada a comercializar ropa nueva en su comunidad, y Blanca de 38 años de edad, comerciante de ropa y calzado de manera ambulante en las calles de la capital. Estas socias representan diversas maneras de trabajar y así obtener el pan de cada día para su familia.
texts.en:
This communal bank is composed of three members who are successful in their businesses, coordinated by Silvia. She is 41 years old, married and has two children who are dependent on her. She sells clothing and food from her house. With this loan she will buy T-shirts, blouses and Lee, Kalua and Big Time jeans. With her previous loans she has made improvements to her house and has grown personally. Which has allowed her to provide a better quality of living for her children.

The other members are Eloisa, who is 32 years old and sells new clothing in her community and Blanca who is 38 years old and sells clothing and footwear in the streets of the capital. These members represent different methods of working to gain their daily bread for their families.

loans.use: to buy clothing like T-shirts, blouses and jeans.

loans.name: Leyda

texts.en:
Through Columbia English Institute, Leyda works hard to provide quality English-language instruction to students all over the northern New Jersey area.  Many of her students are recent immigrants with limited or no English proficiency, and her program helps them to gain the skills they need to succeed both in their personal and professional lives in the US.  Columbia English Institute not only provides students with language skills, it also helps connect them to opportunities for jobs, where they can use their English skills, and other education certifications such as the GED.

Leyda is a repeat borrower in good standing with the Intersect Fund. She used her previous loan to recover from the devastating effects of Hurricane Sandy. She will use the funds of this loan to further her business’ mission by purchasing computers and video equipment for her language learning programs.

loans.use: to purchase new computers and video equipment for her language learning programs.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es: Cesar tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su integridad. Él trabaja en taller de artesanías de barro el cual se encuentra cercano a su localidad. SU vivienda es muy humilde y actualmente el corredor se encuentra en mal estado por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Cesar is 25 years old and lives in his own house together with his family. Cesar is responsible and hard-working. Many people will give him good references about his integrity. He works in a pottery workshop that is located close to his residence. His house is very modest and the corridor is in bad condition. So he has taken the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized laminate, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood and nails to repair the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 53 years old and married with three children. Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs. Josephine hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 46 years old and lives with her family. She sells grocery goods – a business she runs from her home. She has many customers because of her friendliness as she makes a sale. 

Divina is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell so that she can continue working in this business. This is her only source of income, and with this loan she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Julio Wilmer

texts.es:
Julio, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que compra concentrado para ganado, abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, fortalecerá el negocio y contara con los insumos agrícolas necesario s para la próxima siembra de maíz y frijol.
Con el capital anterior aumento la producción de maíz y frijol, su capacidad económica ha mejorado y brinda a su familia un apoyo incondicional.
texts.en: Julio needs to request another loan so that he can buy concentrated feed for his cattle, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to strengthen his business  and purchase the agricultural inputs he needs for the coming planting of corn and beans. With the last loan he increased his production of corn and beans, his economic capacity improved and he could support his family completely.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for his cattle, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for helping and maintaining her coffee plants.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en:
Chhoeurn is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children, two of whom are attending school while the other one is married and lives independently. Chhoeurn resides with her husband and children in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She was inspired by her parents to start rice farming, which is now an important source of income for her family. She has been doing in this field for nearly 25 years.

Chhoeurn’s second child has been engaged to be married soon, so she will arrange a wedding party for her. This will be a great expense for her. That’s why she is seeking a loan to help her cover the costs incurred in the wedding preparation. She hopes to get this loan from Kiva lenders and she is confident to pay it back on time as it’s now her second loan cycle from Hattha Kaksekar. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to cover the costs incurred in wedding preparation.

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Francisca de 43 años de edad,  estudio hasta  5° grado debido a falta de recursos económicos dejo de estudiar, esta casada su esposo se dedica a la carpintería de sus tres hijos uno ya esta casado solo viven dos con ella y asisten a la escuela.  


Francisca se dedica a  los oficios domésticos y cuidado de su familia, desde hace un año trabaja en una iglesia como cocinera debido a su estado económico la llevo a buscar trabajo.  Su día comienza a las 4:00 AM  Para atender a su familia la distancia de su casa esta a cinco minutos a pie entra a trabajar a la 6:30 AM  y sale a 5:00 PM   esa es su rutina diaria. 


El crédito sera invertido, para comprar cerdos para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos.  

Francisca sueña en poder preparar su hijos en una carrera universitaria, poder remodelar su casa y pagar su crédito sin ningún problema para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Francisca is 43 years old and studied up to Grade 5. Due to a lack of financial resources she quit school. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. She has 3 children, one of whom is married and the other two live with her and go to school. Francisca takes care of the household work and cares for her family.

A year ago she started to work as a cook in a church due to their financial situation. Her day starts at 4 am taking care of her family. Her work is a 5 minute walk away and she starts work at 6:30 am and leaves at 5 pm. this is her daily routine.

The loan will be invested buying pigs to fatten and later sell. Francisca dreams of preparing her children for university, renovating her house and paying off the loan with no problem so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elena has been farming vegetables for three years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 33 years old and married. She has four children who are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita works hard to support her family. Anaclita is widowed and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Anaclita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy motorcycle and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Anaclita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 52 years old. She lives with her two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Altangerel is a saleswoman at a building company and is considered very talented by her superiors. Her older son helps his mother by providing a taxi service to local people. 

Altangerel is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to buy building materials such as planks, cement, and bricks for a house extension. Her extension will provide additional space for her son's new family and reduce heat loss through its additional insulation.

loans.use: to build an extension to her house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, is married and a mother of four. She manages a transportation business to earn a living.

With the support of her good husband, her previous loan was used for the service and was successfully repaid.  

Recently, she took a new loan to cover the costs for motor repair. Helen hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for motor repair.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta works hard to support her family. Marietta is married and has a dried-fish business in the Philippines. Marietta has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 55 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Apolinaria works very hard to provide for them.

Apolinaria runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, beers, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, etc. 

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like canned goods, beers, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Apolinaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, beers, snack foods, noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 59 years old and a married mother of nine children. For the past seven years, she has been selling spices in the Philippines. Leonila is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonila is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more spices to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices to sell in her stall

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 28 years old and is a married woman with one child who is in school. For the past three years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Cherryl is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cherryl is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan from NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Liza works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food, running a general store, and buying and selling seaweed. Liza has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF.

Liza is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 37 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Juvy works very hard to provide for them.

Juvy runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, rice, sardines and other groceries. 

Juvy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Juvy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Lai is 36 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom are in school.  She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Bovel district, earning a living through farming rice while her husband grows cassava. Together, they can earn about KHR 86,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Lai has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy school materials for supporting her children’s education. She hopes to have enough school supplies for her children.

loans.use: To buy school materials.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, 40, is married and lives with her husband and five children in a village of the Bovel district of Battambang province. One of her children is still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and beans and they supplement their family’s income through working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 10 years, earning about 15,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Oun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group of three to seek a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy school supplies for her child. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her child.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is 40 years old and widowed with one kid. She and her family live in a village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. To make a living, Sreymom has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She currently earns about 6,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s need. Sreymom is in her sixth cycle of loans with VisionFund. 

Sreymom is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Sreymom hopes to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chansarab's Group

texts.en:
Chansarab is aged 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. 

She and her husband have been selling various kinds of fruits and sometimes they also work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 100,000KHR per day but they can save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chansarab has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more fruit to resale. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District
